title: ENG: Full Hero Carousel
description:
## Goal
We would like to test adding a full hero carousel to the homepage which will improve engagement as measured by CTA clicks within the homepage hero.

This issue is to create the functionality for the home carousel not to implement it live.  We also want this to be a new component and not overwrite the current home hero.  We should use the current home hero as a starting point in this carousel.

- [ ] The carousel transition includes left text and image
- [ ] The user should be able to click to move to the next slide
- [ ] The carousel should be flexible that can handle 2-5 slides
- [ ] When a user mouses over the entire carousel the timer should pause
- [x] Work with @dennischarukulvanich so we can track the CTAs per slide

When engineering is done we should make sure the old hero is on the home page and we can merge this new component to wait for content.

### Jobs To Be Done
* **Situation**: *When ...*
* **Motivation**: *We want to ...*
* **Outcome**: *So we can ...*

## In scope

## Out of scope

- Experience or behaviour changes beyond in scope description

title: Smartling Code Repo Connector - POC
description:
### Background

We've contracted the [Code Repo Connector](https://help.smartling.com/hc/en-us/articles/360008038694-Repository-Connector-Overview#:~:text=The%20Repository%20Connector%20is%20designed,translations%20back%20to%20the%20repository.) with Smartling since the contract began, but we haven't used it. This issue is to track a Proof of Concept for the Smartling Code Repo prior to contracting it this year.

* Note the DRI of the POC will be the Product or Eng Teams (this issue can be moved if necessary)
* Digital Experience team will be DRI related to the website as the Code Repo Connector is an alternative to the GDN (this issue can be copied if necessary)

### Proof of Concept Options

1. TBD

### Comments from Smartling

* Prior to any POC, Smartling requested that we define what a successful POC looks like.
* Our next steps on the website evaluation will be to arrange a technical demo of the Code Repo Connector highlighting any specific use cases or actions the team would like to validate.
* We can schedule a discussion of the pros and cons to use our Repository Connector Vs the GDN to support the website translation initiative both are great options, the deciding factors will be based on your overall strategy/objectives of the website translations project and the team's desired experience/LOE.

### Next Steps

* Determine what we would like to get out of the POC? What questions are we trying to answer / what does success look like?
* Determine POC options for the Code Repo Connector.
* Technical discussion with Smartling related to using the GDN or the Code Repo for website translation.

title: ENG: Slack integration marketing landing page
description:
## Goal
We would like to create a landing page on about.gitlab.com for the Slack/GitLab integration.

Design is attached in design management :arrow_down: 

This landing page needs to meet the Slack guidelines for the landing page are outlined [here](https://api.slack.com/start/distributing/guidelines#landing).

* Must include privacy policy link
* A clear overview of your Slack app, any associated services, and the problem your app solves.
* A detailed explanation of how your app works in Slack. Screenshots and GIFs are a good way to show people what they can expect in Slack after installing your app.
* A clear path to installing your Slack app, whether that is an Add to Slack button on your landing page or instructions for accessing your Add to Slack button.
* A clear path to using your app. Once people install your app to their workspace, they should be redirected to a page that confirms the installation was successful and provides clear next steps for getting started with your app.
* Needs to be publicly accessible i.e. not behind a login.
* Your landing page is, well, a landing page crafted by you, specifically for your Slack app - not a link to a PDF, document or code repository

### Jobs To Be Done
* **Situation**: *When anyone is looking for information about our integration with Slack, there is publically accessible landing page*
* **Motivation**: *We want roll out new Slack GBP app to all gitlab.com users, but current landing page (https://gitlab.com/-/profile/slack/edit) does not match the Slack guidelines*
* **Outcome**: *So we can improve conversions*

## Page(s)
Which page(s) are involved in this request?
* https://about.gitlab.com/solutions/slack/

## DCI
[DRI, Consulted, Informed](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/people-group/directly-responsible-individuals/#dri-consulted-informed-dci)

- [ ] DRI: `GitLab Handle`
- [ ] Consulted: @laurenbarker @katiemacoy @ctsang-ext 
- [ ] Informed: `Everyone`

## In scope
What is within scope of this request?

- [ ] Create a MVC landing page for the Slack integration that meeds requirements from Slack
- [ ] For efficency, use the a solutions template ,[Public Sector](https://about.gitlab.com/solutions/public-sector/)
- [ ] Deploy landing page to `about.gitlab.com`
- [ ] Build page in Buyer Experience

## Out of scope

- And work in the product codebase or `gitlab.com`

title: Smartling GDN - POC - Discovery
description:
### Background
We've contracted the GDN with Smartling since the contract began, but we haven't used it. This issue is to track a Proof of Concept for the Smartling GDN prior to contracting it this year.

Note the DRI of the POC will be the Digital Experience team (this issue can be moved if necessary). 

### Proof of Concept Options
1) Full Deployment - This includes a full deployment of the Smartling GDN and will require Smartling Professional Services to implement. Professional Services hours for this type of POC ranges from 25-30 hours, estimated cost is $5,000-$8,000. The reason for the cost is that we would be able to continue to use the GDN once it is set-up and we add it to the contract.
1) Partial Deployment - We would select a few pages (number TBD) and Smartling would connect these to show us how it works. If it is only a few pages, there wouldn't be a cost to this.
1) In depth technical demo - This would be a 90 minute call with Smartling where they would show us (on their site), a step-by-step demo of how the GDN works. This would not be on our site.

### Comments from Smartling
- Prior to any POC, Smartling requested that we define what a successful POC looks like.
- Our next steps on the website evaluation will be to arrange a technical demo of the GDN on the GitLab website highlighting any specific use cases or actions the team would like to validate.
- Similarly, we can schedule a discussion of the pros and cons to use our Repository Connector Vs the GDN to support the website translation initiative both are great options, the deciding factors will be based on your overall strategy/objectives of the website translations project and the team's desired experience/LOE.

### Next Steps
- Determine what we would like to get out of the POC? What questions are we trying to answer / what does success look like?
- Determine which POC option we are most interested in based on the POC goals.
- Technical discussion with Smartling related to using the GDN or the Code Repo for website translation.


### Requests from Smartling
Smartling asked that we answer these questions prior to our GDN discussion.

1- What is the business objective surrounding translations? (Ex: Drive more leads to the website, convert more leads on the website, support an existing international sales team to convert more deals, etc)
 * Answer: Drive more leads, support an existing sales team to convert more deals

2- What success metric will you be tracking against as it relates to translation (Website metrics (traffic, conversion rates, page views, bounce rate, etc), sales team conversation success, new user adoption, decrease in support tickets, etc)
 * Answer: Website metrics, new INQ, trials
 
3- Please list in the order of priority the content you are looking to translate. (Specific websites, Landing Pages, Blogs, Web application)
 * Answer: Ultimately, we will translate about.gitlab.com and all navigation pages. To start with the POC, we will translate the [Homepage](about.gitlab.com), [Why Gitlab](https://about.gitlab.com/why-gitlab/), [Pricing Page] (https://about.gitlab.com/pricing/)

4- What Technology do you use to create and/or serve this content? (CMS, Marketing Automation, E-Comm Platform, Other?)
 * **Need answer**

5.1- What source language is your content in?
 * Answer: English

5.2- Which language(s) are you translating into?
 * Answer: Japanese, French, German

6- What are your annual translation volumes? (best guess of plan is fine)
 * Answer: Currently around 160k processed words for marketing, but this is expected to increase. Web hasn't been started yet.

7- Stakeholders
a. Who needs to be involved in the evaluation?  Answer: Digital Experience team, Marketing Ops, others TBD
b. Who will be using the tool?  Answer: Digital Experience team (technical GDN), project management DRI TBD
c. Who will be vetting the technology and integration path? Answer: Digital Experience team
d. Who is the budget holder for sign-off? Answer: Marketing Operations

8- Describe your ideal translation process.
 * **Answer: Need answer**

9- Describe the challenges you are facing in the current process.
 * Answer: No solution for web translations currently in place.

10- What do you need to see in our solution to move forward with Smartling? 
 * **Answer: Need answer, what does success look like**

title: Google Analytics Tracking: SaaS Trial Event
description:
## Goal

Review the new SaaS Trial flow here: https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1K-fwk3n_mqN_JDfGGXWMETfIWLPhRoWsEdmV7yJDD-M/

Add the Google Tag Manager JS and OneTrust (if not already included) to the new "About Your Company" page: 
**gitlab.com/users/sign_up/company/new**

Paste this code as high in the `<head>` of the page as possible:
```
<!-- Google Tag Manager -->
<script>(function(w,d,s,l,i){w[l]=w[l]||[];w[l].push({'gtm.start':
new Date().getTime(),event:'gtm.js'});var f=d.getElementsByTagName(s)[0],
j=d.createElement(s),dl=l!='dataLayer'?'&l='+l:'';j.async=true;j.src=
'https://www.googletagmanager.com/gtm.js?id='+i+dl;f.parentNode.insertBefore(j,f);
})(window,document,'script','dataLayer','GTM-NJXWQL');</script>
<!-- End Google Tag Manager -->
```

Additionally, paste this code immediately after the opening `<body>` tag:
```
<!-- Google Tag Manager (noscript) -->
<noscript><iframe src="https://www.googletagmanager.com/ns.html?id=GTM-NJXWQL"
height="0" width="0" style="display:none;visibility:hidden"></iframe></noscript>
<!-- End Google Tag Manager (noscript) -->
```


Fire the following dataLayer event upon a successful form submission after the "Continue" button click. The `aboutYourCompanyType` should be dynamic. If the user is part of the Free Account flow, they will have an additional toggle field "Gitlab Ultimate Trial". If the user is part of the SaaS flow, the field should not be there, so the variable value should be `ultimate_trial`. 
```
dataLayer.push({
  'event':'aboutYourCompanyFormSubmit',
  'aboutYourCompanyType':'[ultimate_trial or free_account]'
});
```


## Page(s)
Which page(s) are involved in this request?
* gitlab.com/users/sign_up/company/new

title: ENG: Implement Launchdarkly with Custom Events
description:
## Goal

According to this [support ticket](https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/-/uploads/852679b3678d1a281b31d99956848d78/Hello__We_are_using_Launchd...___LaunchDarkly.pdf), we need to make sure our metrics are set up as custom events within LaunchDarkly. 

> If you are changing the URL upon click, you would have to use a custom conversion (Such as if
you were submitting a form that redirects to a new page, etc.).

> If your click metric triggers a page redirect, then the redirect is happening before the click
event can be sent back to LaunchDarkly.

> Click metrics are unfortunately not very robust; I would suggest recreating the metric as a
custom conversion metric instead:
https://docs.launchdarkly.com/home/experimentation/metrics/custom-conversion.

> This way, you have greater control and can call track when you need to and flush immediately
right after to ensure that the metric event is captured prior to redirect.

Hypothesis: The behavior that I have when using click events is that clicking on said targets will result in incrementing the unique visitors by 1.  

## DCI
[DRI, Consulted, Informed](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/people-group/directly-responsible-individuals/#dri-consulted-informed-dci)

title: Docs Subdomain - Update Google Tag Manager ID
description:
## Goal
The current Google Tag Manager account ID on the docs subdomain is set to `GTM-WZCXKT5` - no one can access this GTM account because it was created by a former employee on their personal work email address. There is an issue within the Google Analytics page URL data where `/index.html` needs to be included in order to match the correlated `index.md` file (analyzed by the technical content writers). Related GitLab [issue here](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/buyer-experience/-/issues/1214#note_1064405619). 

In order to affix `/index.html`, we'll need to first update the Google Tag Manager ID from `GTM-WZCXKT5` to `GTM-NJXWQL` on docs.gitlab.com, that way we can configure a new GA tags on a GTM account we have access to. 

### Instructions

- Revise the existing GTM code in the `<head>` by switching the ID from `GTM-WZCXKT5` to `GTM-NJXWQL` (<https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-docs/-/blob/main/content/assets/javascripts/google_tagmanager.js>):

  ```js
  (function(w,d,s,l,i){w[l]=w[l]||[];w[l].push({'gtm.start':
  new Date().getTime(),event:'gtm.js'});var f=d.getElementsByTagName(s)[0],
  j=d.createElement(s),dl=l!='dataLayer'?'&l='+l:'';j.async=true;j.src=
  'https://www.googletagmanager.com/gtm.js?id='+i+dl;f.parentNode.insertBefore(j,f);
  })(window,document,'script','dataLayer','GTM-NJXWQL');
  ```

- Additionally, update the ID in GTM `<body>` tag (<https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-docs/-/blob/main/layouts/gtm.html>):

  ```html
  <!-- Google Tag Manager (noscript) -->
  <noscript><iframe src="https://www.googletagmanager.com/ns.html?id=GTM-NJXWQL"
  height="0" width="0" style="display:none;visibility:hidden"></iframe></noscript>
  <!-- End Google Tag Manager (noscript) -->
  ```


## Page(s)
Which page(s) are involved in this request?
* All docs.gitlab.com pages

[DRI, Consulted, Informed](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/people-group/directly-responsible-individuals/#dri-consulted-informed-dci)

title: Release: Launch Qualtrics survey on Help Topics page
description:
## Goal We would like to learn more about the Get Help page to find opportunities for improvement by implementing a Qualtrics survey that was completed as part of this issue. **What the survey is for**
To determine what users are expecting to find on the [Help Topics](https://about.gitlab.com/get-help/) page. **Who the survey is to be completed by**
Everyone who comes to the Help Topics page **How the survey delivered to user**
Immediately on arrival of the Help Topics page using a notification in the corner of the page like [this](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/inbound-marketing/growth/-/issues/791#note_651041011) but with updated branding. **What URL and platform the survey is hosted on**
[Qualtrics ](https://gitlab.fra1.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_brobq0o5o2Fdtu6) **How long the survey is open**
Open until we get 200 responses. ![Screen_Shot_2021-08-13_at_14.18.24](/uploads/c718e6a9e840da6edc70c450ead168d8/Screen_Shot_2021-08-13_at_14.18.24.png) ### Jobs To Be Done * **Situation**: *When a user visits the get help page, a notification displays in the corner for the survey* * **Motivation**: *We want to gather data on what users are looking for when the arrive on the get help page* * **Outcome**: *So we can improve our get help page* ## Page(s) Which page(s) are involved in this request? * `https://about.gitlab.com/get-help/` ## DCI [DRI, Consulted, Informed](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/people-group/directly-responsible-individuals/#dri-consulted-informed-dci) - [ ] DRI: `GitLab Handle` - [ ] Consulted: @laurenbarker @ctsang-ext - [ ] Informed: `Everyone` ## In scope What is within scope of this request? - [ ] Create notification for survey on Get Help Page, linking out to [this survey](https://gitlab.fra1.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_brobq0o5o2Fdtu6) - [ ] Answer in thread: Is it also possible to gather what page each person is at before they get to the Get Help page? ## Requirements What are the requirements for this request? Checklist below is an example of common requirements, please check all that apply and adjust as necessary: - [ ] Copy writing - [ ] Illustration - [ ] Custom Graphics - [ ] Research - [ ] Data / Analytics - [x] UX Design - [x] Engineering

description:

title: Request to Remove Event Details Section from PubSec Page
description:
## Goal
We would like to remove the event details section from the [PubSec page](https://about.gitlab.com/solutions/public-sector/). Unfortunately, this is a completely manual process and we have to remember to update the page every time an event listed occurs so old events are not still listed on the page. We don't believe we're getting much traction from the page for events and would like to, instead, just link to our [GitLab Events Page](https://about.gitlab.com/events/).

### Jobs To Be Done
* **Situation**: Remove event details from PubSec page
* **Motivation**: Very inefficient and manual process
* **Outcome**: Be more efficient and just link to our current events page

* [PubSec Page](https://about.gitlab.com/solutions/public-sector/)

title: Website Bug: GitLab Learn for everyone link goes to 404 page
description:
This template is for filing a bug report related to the logged out marketing website https://about.gitlab.com/ and company handbook https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/

This is not the correct repository for requests related to docs.gitlab.com, the GitLab product, or other items.

#### What is/are the relevant URL(s)

https://about.gitlab.com/learn/certifications/public/

#### Briefly describe the bug

Example: A link is broken

The [GitLab Learn for everyone link ](https://about.gitlab.com/learn/public/) is broken and takes user to a 404 page

#### If possible, please specify how to reproduce the bug

1. Navigate to https://about.gitlab.com/learn/certifications/public/
2. Click on the GitLab Learn for everyone link

#### Please provide any relevant screenshots or screencasts

How to take a screenshot: https://www.howtogeek.com/205375/how-to-take-screenshots-on-almost-any-device/

![image](/uploads/b9bca29bed3de6d18f730bd5d1b33061/image.png)
![image](/uploads/496c58a95a4e223b2ffdfd36afe8979d/image.png)

#### What is your window size, browser, operating system, and versions

Please use the following website to determine your browser specifications and provide a link developers can follow:

What is my browser https://www.whatsmybrowser.org

https://www.whatsmybrowser.org/b/8LTBD

#### What computing device are you using?

Please list the brand and model (Example: Samsung Galaxy S 10 Plus)

Windows 10 desktop

### What type of input are you attempting to use?

Webpage interactivity is often tied to a specific device event.

- [ ] Touchscreen
- [ ] Touchpad
- [x] Mouse click
- [ ] Mouse click and drag
- [ ] Scrollwheel
- [ ] Keyboard
- [ ] Stylus
- [ ] Other (please specify)

#### Have you tried a fresh incognito window? Could this be related to cookies or account type/state?

- [x] I tried a fresh incognito window & it had no impact.
- [ ] The problem goes away when using an incognito window.
- [ ] The problem only happens when certain cookies are set to a specific value (please specify below).

#### Please list any browser plugins you have enabled

Why do we ask for this? Certain website bugs may be caused by plugins. For example: Adblock, noscript, ghostery, safe browsing.

None

#### Are you blocking javascript or any other resources?

Javascript is needed for certain website functionality.

- [ ] I AM blocking javascript or other resources.
- [x] I am NOT blocking javascript or other resources.

#### What is your geographic location

Why do we ask for this? Certain bugs may be geographically related. For example, if you're in the European Union, it could be related to GDPR policy and cookies.

New Zealand

#### What type of network are you connected to?

**Type**

- [X] Wired
- [ ] Wifi
- [ ] Cellular (4G, 5G, etc)
- [ ] Satellite
- [ ] Other

`Insert details here if applicable`

**Location**

- [X] Home
- [X] Workplace
- [ ] Travel facility (hotel, airport, conference center, etc)
- [ ] Public venue (restaurant, library, cafe, etc)
- [ ] VPN
- [ ] Other

`Insert details here if applicable`

**Hardware**

- [ ] I am behind a network security appliance such as a firewall
- [ ] I am using a pi-hole or other hardware-based traffic blocker
- [ ] Other

`Insert details here if applicable`

title: Privacy Policy - Footer Link Changes on Marketing Site
description:
## Goal

We would like to do two things:

1.  Remove the Privacy Policy parenthetical on the about.gitlab.com site that states the "last updated" date.  It's been over one-month now so we can remove that information
2. Change the name of the footer link from `Privacy Policy` to `Privacy Statement`

## Date/Timeline

We would not like to make this update until the end of August 2022.  

### Jobs To Be Done
* **Situation**: *When a user goes to our site they wont' be informed of the last updated date, as the period for notice/comments is effectively over.  Also, the name change to the link is more accurate.*
* **Motivation**: *We want to update the terminology to better reflect the intent of the document*
* **Outcome**: *So we can inform users*

## Page(s)
Which page(s) are involved in this request?
* `Every page on about.gitlab.com`

## DCI
[DRI, Consulted, Informed](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/people-group/directly-responsible-individuals/#dri-consulted-informed-dci)

title: SPIKE: Enable support pages to consume markdown
description:
## Goal
We would like to investigate using markdown for support content. HTML markup mixed in with the [support.yml](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/buyer-experience/-/blob/main/content/support/index.yml#L101) content. 

### Jobs To Be Done
* **Situation**: *Investigate level of effort to enable markdown content in support content files*
* **Motivation**: *We want to enable the support team to manage content through markdown*
* **Outcome**: *So we can help the support self serve updates to our support pages*

## Page(s)
Which page(s) are involved in this request?
* https://about.gitlab.com/support/ and all child pages

## DCI
[DRI, Consulted, Informed](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/people-group/directly-responsible-individuals/#dri-consulted-informed-dci)

- [ ] DRI: `GitLab Handle`
- [ ] Consulted: @laurenbarker @jcolyer 
- [ ] Informed: `Everyone`

## In scope
What is within scope of this request?

- [ ] Investigate if markdown content is consumable [`support-copy:block:text`](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/buyer-experience/-/blob/main/content/support/index.yml#L101) area of the content file
- [ ] Determine how to enable markdown if it is not and level of effort

## Out of scope
What is out of scope and not part of this iteration?

- Actually enabling it or implementing markdown


## Requirements
What are the requirements for this request? Checklist below is an example of common requirements, please check all that apply and adjust as necessary:

- [ ] Copy writing
- [ ] Illustration
- [ ] Custom Graphics
- [ ] Research
- [ ] Data / Analytics
- [ ] UX Design
- [x] Engineering

title: Typography Adjustment - Support Template
description:
## Goal
The typography on the main support page seems "off" compared to [the Figma template](https://www.figma.com/file/xbqYq5HSsiwZXikHpvXnCj/Support-Refresh?node-id=388%3A12778). Some things I've noticed are: 

| Section | Figma | https://about.gitlab.com/support/ | Screen Shot | Style |
|---------|-------|-----------------------------------|-------------|-------------|
| [Test in priorty support table](https://about.gitlab.com/support/#priority-support) | font size: 16px | font size: 20px | ![Screen_Shot_2022-08-09_at_10.33.15_AM](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/buyer-experience/uploads/612518b1cc680dd6ca9018f9349210ae/Screen_Shot_2022-08-09_at_10.33.15_AM.png) | Body 2 | 
| All bulleted text | font size: 16px, line-height: 24px , text-indent: 16px | font size: 20px, line-height: 24px, no text indent | ![Screen_Shot_2022-08-09_at_10.35.04_AM](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/buyer-experience/uploads/06ed51d092f1d2ec7332dfa8426acfa1/Screen_Shot_2022-08-09_at_10.35.04_AM.png) | Lists |
| More Help @ bottom | ![image](/uploads/fcb3130c5a0245828f47e7a1c5436efd/image.png) | duplicated text at font-size: 16px, line-height: 24px | ![Screen_Shot_2022-08-09_at_10.39.14_AM](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/buyer-experience/uploads/17c1d2b27b718f9442527f4eb21f4998/Screen_Shot_2022-08-09_at_10.39.14_AM.png) | None, please remove smaller text |


make sure we are following the grid, per comment above:

| In production | In design |
| ------ | ------ |
| ![image](/uploads/baa8f2dbe85e4888dcfbfd87440363cf/image.png) | ![image](/uploads/4a3ded715cb93079b43a232e5408ae92/image.png) |


### What's my browser?

title: ENG: Results by Type - Blog, Handbook, All
description:
## Goal
We would like add a feature to our search results that enables users to view results by type.

We want to let users know how many results exist in the Blog, Handbook, Everything, and enable them to view just those results. 

![Screen_Shot_2022-08-02_at_8.56.40_AM](/uploads/9ff57896dc7fafb71c0636d2ae53525e/Screen_Shot_2022-08-02_at_8.56.40_AM.png)

### Jobs To Be Done
* **Situation**: *A user can sort results by type that is powered by Swiftype site search API.*
* **Motivation**: *We want to lower bounce rate, increased pages per session, and increased time on site.*
* **Outcome**: *So we can increase engagement.*

## Page(s)
Which page(s) are involved in this request?
* The search bar in the navigation

description:
## Goal
We would like to synchronize feature.yml in both the www repository and the buyer experience repository.

**How?**

_This is just a rough idea, I haven't looked into it much_

Create a step in the www-gitlab-com pipeline that either uses gitlab-api GET, gitlab pages, or whatever else to host features.yml. Then in Buyer Experience write a script/another step in the build to curl the file down.

title: Define requirements to consume Swiftype API
description:
## Goal
We would like to define requirements for about.gitlab.com to consume the Swiftype API. This will enable us to customize the search experience and execute on the parent OKR of this issue. 

### Jobs To Be Done
* **Situation**: *We are using a javascript snippet from Swiftype to enable search functionality, as documented in the [quick start guide here](https://swiftype.com/documentation/site-search/crawler-quick-start). This limits our ability to customize the experience.*
* **Motivation**: *We want to implement the [Swiftype site search API](https://swiftype.com/documentation/site-search/overview) to programmatically alter how our 
  * pages are crawled
  * documents are indexed
  * searches are completed
  * analytics are generated
  * and more!
* **Outcome**: *To do this, we need to define requirements to implement the site search API on about.gitlab.com.*

## Page(s)
Which page(s) are involved in this request?
* about.gitlab.com - search that exists in the header
* https://swiftype.com/documentation/site-search/overview 

## DCI

title: Enable feature flags for Buyer Experience repository
description:
## Goal
We would like to enable feature flags for the Buyer Experience repository.

### Jobs To Be Done
Feature flags deploy your application’s new features to production in smaller batches. You can toggle a feature on and off to subsets of users, helping you achieve Continuous Delivery. Feature flags help reduce risk, allowing you to do controlled testing, and separate feature delivery from customer launch.

https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/operations/feature_flags.html

Related https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/-/epics/133 

## Page(s)
Which page(s) are involved in this request?
* https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/buyer-experience

## DCI
[DRI, Consulted, Informed](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/people-group/directly-responsible-individuals/#dri-consulted-informed-dci)

- [ ] DRI: `GitLab Handle`
- [ ] Consulted: @laurenbarker 
- [ ] Informed: `Everyone`

## In scope
What is within scope of this request?

- [ ] Enable feature flag functionality for Buyer Experience repository
- [ ] Create a test feature flag, enable it, monitor, and verify it is working. This test could be a hidden code comment in the footer or similar that is not present to our users.
- [ ] Disable the test feature flag
- [ ] Create a video demonstrating how to use feature flags in the Buyer Experience repository. Post the video to our Digital Experience playlist on GitLab Unfiltered
- [ ] Document the process in our handbook, and link to the video

## Out of scope
What is out of scope and not part of this iteration?

- Any other feature flag testing - those will need new issues. This is just the creation and implementation of a control feature flag to verify the functionality is working.

## Requirements
What are the requirements for this request? Checklist below is an example of common requirements, please check all that apply and adjust as necessary:

- [ ] Data / Analytics

title: Improve how bullets are presented on pricing page
description:
Bullets in the Pricing Page FAQ are rendered incorrectly, for example:

![image](/uploads/d933529984deeb65c43ddb308c4da533/image.png)

We should try to fix this, as it is hard to convey more than a few lines in these answers clearly otherwise.

title: Update to SlpDropdown to allow option names different from their values
description:
Our SlpDropdown component currently takes in a list of options and gives each `<option>` tag's `name` and `value` attribute the same name. This is problematic for items where the value needs to be altered from the name/label that the user sees.

Example:
Building a filter by location for the Commit page. We want the filter option to read 'New York City', but the list of items it's filtering through have a location of 'NYC'. It would be nice if the HTML could look like `<option name="New York City" value="nyc" />`

title: GA: Turn off tracking for Denmark, Norway, France, Italy, and Austria
description: ## Goal Related note: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/buyer-experience/-/issues/997#note_1025872795 Recent laws were passed that declared Google Analytics illegal since EU data is processed on a US server. Turn off Google Analytics entirely in Denmark, Austria, France, Italy and Norway. Please refer to this OneTrust Geolocation Exposure script: https://community.cookiepro.com/s/article/UUID-f1caf6bb-0003-8e79-6caf-2a7d04e357d7?language=en_US This line will grab the country ID from OneTrust: `var country = options.country.toString();` The geolocation script is already on placed: Please place the following code before the GTM script, but after the Geolocation Exposure script on all pages: - about.gitlab.com - page.gitlab.com - learn.gitlab.com - gitlab.com (public facing pages) - docs.gitlab.com ``` ``` On Google Tag Manager, apply the oneTrustCountryId dataLayer variable to all Google Analytics tags to the trigger, so the tag doesn't fire for: DK, AT, FR, IT and NO. ## Page(s) Which page(s) are involved in this request? - about.gitlab.com - page.gitlab.com - learn.gitlab.com - gitlab.com (public facing pages) - docs.gitlab.com ## DCI [DRI, Consulted, Informed](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/people-group/directly-responsible-individuals/#dri-consulted-informed-dci) - [ ] DRI: @dennischarukulvanich @miraclebanks @jgarc - [ ] Consulted: @laurenbarker @justin.vetter @RobRosu @emccrann @BronwynBarnett @MihaiConteanu - [ ] Informed: @mpreuss22 @christinelee @dmicovic @jahye1 @degan @rkohnke ## Requirements What are the requirements for this request? Checklist below is an example of common requirements, please check all that apply and adjust as necessary: - [ ] Copy writing - [ ] Illustration - [ ] Custom Graphics - [ ] Research - [x] Data / Analytics - [ ] UX Design - [x] Engineering

title: Add Minimized Footer to Navigation Repository
description:
## Goal
We would like to add the minimized footer to the Nav repository so we can use it within Buyer Experience

As part of the refresh a few months ago, we created a minimized footer with a goal for it to be used on the Pricing page. Looks like it is not being used there anymore, but the mini-footer still lives in BE. It would be nice to use for our Commit page, but the Web IDE and View Source buttons are not dynamic to the page/do not work. Also, @justin.vetter proposed a good point in that the mini-footer does not contain any legal type of links, such as our Privacy policy.





## DCI
[DRI, Consulted, Informed](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/people-group/directly-responsible-individuals/#dri-consulted-informed-dci)

- [ ] DRI: `Search, Nav, and Support Team`
- [ ] Consulted: @jhalloran @meganfilo @justin.vetter 
- [ ] Informed: `Everyone`

## In scope
What is within scope of this request?

1. Investigate and add, if applicable, any necessary links to the minimized footer
2. Add the mini-footer html and styles (found in BE at `/components/footer/minimized-footer.vue`) to the Navigation repository (OR! Refactor the current footer to take in some kind of prop that will make it change to be mini on a page)
3. Fix the View Source and Web IDE links to work dynamically depending on what page the footer is used on

## Out of scope
What is out of scope and not part of this iteration?

- Add the minimized footer to any pages, we can save that for future issues.


## Requirements

- [ ] Data / Analytics

- [x] Engineering

title: [SPIKE] Understanding features.yml
description:
# Investigate features.yml
### Introduction
The www-gitlab-com repository has 1 massive data file, features.yml, and 2 smaller related files, categories.yml and stages.yml:
- features.yml is over 11,000 lines long with 554 features.
- categories.yml is over 2500 lines long with 132 categories.
- stages.yml is over 2300 lines long.


### Why is it an issue?
Last year (2021) the decision was made to start migrating the marketing site from the www-gitlab-com repository into a new repository (buyer experience). This year, there are efforts being made to migrate the handbook out of the www-gitlab-com repository and into it's own. Since the features.yml file feeds content to both the handbook and buyer experience pages, we need to come up with an automated solution. While coming up with the solution we should also rethink the data structure, and how we can best serve the people using it (product). How can we make the product teams life easier while satisfying the needs of handbook and buyer experience.

# Usage
Last 20 updates to features.yml
- 18 unique contributors
    - 12 from product
    - 6 from engineering
- 8 added features
- 2 removed features
- 9 modified features
- 1 Update to PPS scores

~2 changes a week to file

### Related pages/links:
- https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/digital-experience/website/ - Resource

### Pages that read from features.yml
**www-gitlab-com**
- https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/strategic-marketing/dot-com-vs-self-managed/
- https://about.gitlab.com/features/by-theme/ 
- https://about.gitlab.com/features/by-paid-tier/ 
- https://about.gitlab.com/devops-tools/
- https://about.gitlab.com/pricing/gitlab-com/feature-comparison/
- https://about.gitlab.com/stages-devops-lifecycle/ (for everything in stages-devops-lifecycle/)
- https://about.gitlab.com/devops-tools/circle-ci-vs-gitlab/ (all the comparison pages)

**Buyer Experience**
- https://about.gitlab.com/pricing/
- https://about.gitlab.com/features/
- https://about.gitlab.com/pricing/premium/
- https://about.gitlab.com/pricing/ultimate
- https://about.gitlab.com/stages-devops-lifecycle/ (for everything in stages-devops-lifecycle/)
- https://about.gitlab.com/pricing/self-managed/feature-comparison/

title: Follow-up from "Removal of 155 stale images"
description:
As we remove pages from the `www-gitlab-com`, assets are becoming obsolete. Lets write a script that removes unused assets from the repository. This will have compounding beneficial effects - every pipeline is faster, cloning the repository is faster, and the size the repository becomes smaller.

The first iteration of this script [here](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/www-gitlab-com/-/merge_requests/101054). Unfortunately, that script takes too long to run through the `www-gitlab-com` repository. For the next iteration of this script, we'll create an array of image filenames and search the repository once. This should reduce the amount of time it takes for the script to complete.

## In scope
What is within scope of this request?

- [x] Iterate on https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/www-gitlab-com/-/blob/master/scripts/cleanup-delete-stale-images.sh  script that removes unused assets from the www-gitlab-com repository
- [x] Add script to buyer experience repository


--- 

`@tywilliams` outlined a good strategy to make this faster in the following discussion from gitlab-com/www-gitlab-com!101054:

- [ ] @laurenbarker started a [discussion](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/www-gitlab-com/-/merge_requests/101054#note_882910627):  (+3 comments)

    > @tywilliams Got any tips for making this script faster? 
    > 
    > It seems to go slow due to the size of the repository. It only found 9 images in 1 hour before I had to quit it since I'm about to pack up for the day. 
    > 
    > Should I just run it overnight and keep the computer from sleeping?

title: Make sure all links in Buyer Experience are relative links
description:
This is a follow up to a request from @mpreuss22 in [Slack](https://gitlab.slack.com/archives/CN8AVSFEY/p1647985950478389?thread_ts=1647985257.315629&cid=CN8AVSFEY):

> is there a way to dynamically set all links to go to pages within this experience? Currently they link out to the live site.

Michael is referring to the review app at [https://refresh.about.gitlab-review.app/](https://refresh.about.gitlab-review.app/). But more generally, this issue will happen to *any* review app, if we use absolute URLs.

Our lives will be a lot easier for local development, review app feedback, and production deployments if we use relative paths across this website. 

As an example, an absolute path is: `https://about.gitlab.com/enterprise/`. Whereas the relative path would be `/enterprise/`. 

The advantage of using the relative path is that it keeps users on the same root domain as they navigate a particular deployment. It also ensure that we don't accidentally click links and go to different environments in development. 

This is the same approach we should take for images (until we get a digital asset management tool, which will change the strategy). Images should refer to relative file paths, and should exist in our repository. 

I think the fix for this is for someone to go through and:

1. Search the entire Buyer Experience repository for references to `https://about.gitlab.com`
1. Convert the reference to be a relative link (where applicable - there may be some edge cases that really should always point to production, but I can't think of any off the top of my head)
1. We should consider a linter that will check for this, although truthfully I think that's a hard problem to solve, because sometimes we really truly need to write an absolute path (again, I can't think of when, but we might), and I don't love having linters check every single text file for these kinds of strings. It will slow down our CI. Personally, I would prefer to catch this in code review where we can. But if someone has a better, automated proposal, I'm all ears.

title: DataLayer Updates for Contact Sales, Public Sector, and Self-Managed Trials
description:
## Goal
DataLayer values for Contact Sales, Public Sector, and Self Managed Trials form submissions were accidentally updated to "Demo" recently. Conversions for these form types dropped on Google Analytics (Goals 11, 12, 20), and are counted towards the Demo conversion instead (Goal 15). 

Revert the Marketo form submit dataLayer code back to the original values. 

1. **about.gitlab.com/free-trial/**
Update Self Managed form submit dataLayer code back from `demo` to `trial`

2. **about.gitlab.com/solutions/public-sector/**
Update Private Section Contact Sales form submit dataLayer code back from `demo` to `public-sector`

3. **about.gitlab.com/sales/**
Update Contact Sales form submit dataLayer code back, from `demo` to `sales`


### Jobs To Be Done
* **Situation**: When users submit a form
* **Motivation**: We want to capture the event as a dataLayer
* **Outcome**: So we can make analyze leads generated by form type and calculate ROAS across marketing campaigns


## Page(s)
Which page(s) are involved in this request?
* about.gitlab.com/free-trial/
* about.gitlab.com/sales/
* about.gitlab.com/solutions/public-sector/

title: Spike a better solution for handling data in Nuxt pages
description:
## Goal

We'd like to manage the content in the Nuxt site in a more consistent, extensible, flexible way. 

The pages this matters most for are in the upcoming work. `@mpreuss22` gave us the [rundown of our current commitment in Slack]():

Goal is to deliver 10 amazing, newly designed pages with the rest of the site being on brand, live by April 27th:

Tier 01 (Doing 2nd): 3-4 page templates - Complete new vision, design, and content
* Homepage
* Pricing Page
* Solutions / Features Pages
* Install (stretch)

Tier 02 (Doing 3rd): 6-7 page templates - Well considered new design, significant new content, limited new branded/image/motion assets

* Category Leadership (Currently called Topics)
* Demo
* Enterprise
* SMB
* DevOps Lifecycle Pages
* Getting Started
* Contact Sales

Tier 03 (Doing 1st): - New coat of paint: updated fonts, colours, logos
Everything else: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1ualGLPCyFjEpiskrfAe2ftqoTAw8t56lO1LMzMT7Ojo/edit

So to start, I'm going to look at the Tier 01 pages and do the following: 

1. See which, if any, we have represented in `content`
1. Take a look at how their page level `.vue` files consume that data
1. Identify common data structures, identify oddities and outliers (stuff that needs special handling)
1. Write up a spec for how we should structure data to be consumed by pages
1. Pitch that spec to @ndubord as a first iteration 

Once I do that, I'll write up an interface and try it out on the Homepage. I'll put together more specific issues for each page as I go. 

I'm going to timebox this to about a day-and-a-half, and see how far I can get on it. Once I know more, I'll add additional points, add additional issues, etc.

title: Automate removal of unused assets from www-gitlab-com
description:
## Goal
As we remove pages from the www-gitlab-com, assets are becoming obsolete. Lets write a script that removes unused assets from the repository. This will have compounding beneficial effects - every pipeline is faster, cloning the repository is faster, and the size the repository becomes smaller. 

## Page(s)
Which page(s) are involved in this request?
* https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/www-gitlab-com

## DCI
[DRI, Consulted, Informed](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/people-group/directly-responsible-individuals/#dri-consulted-informed-dci)

- [ ] DRI: @laurenbarker 
- [ ] Consulted: @ndubord 
- [ ] Informed: `Everyone`

## In scope
What is within scope of this request?

- [ ] Create script that removes unused assets from the www-gitlab-com repository
- [ ] Remove the unused assets

## Out of scope
What is out of scope and not part of this iteration?

[Screenshot attached]

title: H1 Heading Changed
description:
The H1s on /topics pages have been removed and replaced with H2s. H1 headings are a ranking factor for search engines as they use the H1 heading to determine what the page is about. 

Affected URLs:
| URL                                              |
|--------------------------------------------------|
| https://about.gitlab.com/topics/ci-cd/           |
| https://about.gitlab.com/topics/devops-platform/ |
| https://about.gitlab.com/topics/devops/          |
| https://about.gitlab.com/topics/gitops/          |
| https://about.gitlab.com/topics/microservices/   |
| https://about.gitlab.com/topics/multicloud/      |
| https://about.gitlab.com/topics/serverless/      |
| https://about.gitlab.com/topics/version-control/ |

title: Add Script to Webpages to Hide Web Navigation in PathFactory Tracks
description:
## Goal
We would like to add a script to some of our webpages, so that we can hide the web navigation header and footer when the page is added to a PathFactory track, in order to improve user experience. 
- [Example of a blogpost within a PF track](https://learn.gitlab.com/devsecops-aware/why-implementing-sec)
- [Example of a case study within a PF track](https://learn.gitlab.com/ci-purchase-prac1/goldman-sachs-gitlab)

Additional information about this project can be found [here](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/marketing-operations/-/issues/6077).

### Jobs To Be Done
* **Situation**: *When webpages are added to PathFactory tracks*
* **Motivation**: *We want them to look more organic and to display without the header/foot navigation*
* **Outcome**: *So we can provide a clean, intuitive user experience*

## Page(s)
Which page(s) are involved in this request?
* `All blog posts`
* `All case studies`
* [Pricing page](https://about.gitlab.com/pricing/)
- [x] @eirinipan to confirm that this is an accurate list

## DCI
[DRI, Consulted, Informed](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/people-group/directly-responsible-individuals/#dri-consulted-informed-dci)

- [ ] DRI: @nikkiroth 
- [ ] Consulted: @eirinipan @mpreuss22 
- [ ] Informed: @jgragnola @amy.waller 

## In scope
What is within scope of this request?

- [ ] Add the following to our web pages (once confirmed above). This will allow the function to hide the header and footer.

// --- Note: The code snippet needs to run after the elements in the script below are loaded.  *---

```
<script>
   var windowURL = window.location.search;
   console.log(windowURL);

   if (windowURL.indexOf('menu=hide') > -1 && window.self!= window.top){                          
     document.querySelector('#global-nav ').style.display = 'none';
     document.querySelector('.footer.footer').style.display = 'none';
}
</script>
```

## Out of scope
What is out of scope and not part of this iteration?

- Any other changes/edits/requests

## Requirements
What are the requirements for this request? Checklist below is an example of common requirements, please check all that apply and adjust as necessary:

- [x] Engineering

title: Update FAQ Schema function to take in and render markdown
description:
Related to [485](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/buyer-experience/-/issues/485#note_867644026)

We want the ability for our FAQSchema function in `craftSchema.ts` to take in Markdown from YML files and render appropriate HTML tags.
A use case for this would be the CI/CD topics page's FAQPage schema that [contains unordered lists](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/www-gitlab-com/-/merge_requests/96884/diffs#975ff1cbc57036d902929f48442254eea9dc1f92_149_0).


+a reminder to check and see if the topics/DevOps FaqPage schema is working in search engines.

title: Linked in Event Tracking for Gated Asset download
description:
## Goal
Follow up from https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/buyer-experience/-/issues/238. 

Here are the conversion tags that we have in LinkedIn that we are looking to get implemented. I am unsure how the conversion tags have been set up in the, so unsure where on the page these need to be added.

* Gated Asset download- `window.lintrk('track', { conversion_id: 1111282 });`

* PathFactory form submit event is hardcoded for GA. Would it be possible to add the LinkedIn conversion event code for Gated Asset right below this line? `ga('send', 'event', 'forms', 'submit', 'PathFactory');` ![Screen_Shot_2022-02-24_at_11.20.51_AM](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/buyer-experience/uploads/d9c889c5c0392d6e1eddfa479ccc2dcd/Screen_Shot_2022-02-24_at_11.20.51_AM.png)

### Jobs To Be Done
* **Situation**: *When we want to track Gated Asset downloads*
* **Motivation**: *We want to add LinkedIn conversion codes*
* **Outcome**: *So we can efficiently track the clicks of our users' data*

title: Create GA View to track Customer Portal and other purchasing flows
description:
<!-- Please submit issue with the following format: As a _____ (role in marketing), I would like to ____________(need), so that ________________(reason).-->
<!-- Example: As GTM management, I would like to know that all Trials are MQLing, so that MQL metrics are accurate and we can rely on them for decision making.-->

## As a team focused on customer self-service transactions, I would like a dedicated GA View to provide fast reporting on trial and checkout flows without having to set up custom reports or drill down many levels.

# What we need to know:

## The problem

The Self-Service team would like to track sessions, pageviews, and events (clicks) on the areas of our marketing site and customer portal that our customers use to subscribe and grow. These areas of the site get relatively less traffic compared to marketing and handbook pages, and so are more challenging to report on using the default GA view.

## What specific questions do we need to answer?

- General default GA reporting (Audience, Acquisition, Content, Events) but specific to these parts of the site/customer portal

## What are your must-have's?

These subdomains and pages:

Subdomain:

* customers.gitlab.com

Pages within gitlab.com (regex match):

* /-/subscriptions
* /-/profile/usage_quotas
* /-/usage_quotas
* /trials/
* /pricing/
* /sign_up
* /trial_registrations/

## Do you have any specific metrics, categories or charts in mind?

No, standard GA

## Context

- Audience: Internal GitLab team members, especially Self-Service, Product Intelligence
- When will this likely deliver business value? Immediately
- Due date: ASAP
- Format: GA View


<!-- Please leave the label below on this issue -->
Related to gitlab-com/marketing/marketing-strategy-performance#612.

title: Add import button GTM events in the combined groups/projects form
description:
## Goal

This issue is related to https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/buyer-experience/-/issues/361, which will be closed with https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/81035.

The combined groups/projects form is [now a part of the free trial flow](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/17e-EyBU7gHIZb_C0LrTfAuncLQW6q4LsuqIQ5qh0FTo/edit#slide=id.g110748f05b3_0_42).

The [old spec](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/buyer-experience/uploads/63d466fbba4fca773f6c5a2a356a37c8/Gitlab_GTM_DataLayer_Spec_for_Free_Trial.pdf) had events handled separately for group/project forms. Now we need to combine them. 

### Jobs To Be Done

* **Situation**: *When a user goes through the sign up flow*
* **Motivation**: *We want to track the import project GTM events*
* **Outcome**: *So we can measure free trials and other form interactions against Google Analytics data*

## Page(s)

Which page(s) are involved in this request?
* `gitlab.com/users/sign_up/groups_projects/new`

## DCI

[DRI, Consulted, Informed](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/people-group/directly-responsible-individuals/#dri-consulted-informed-dci)

- [ ] DRI: @tywilliams 
- [ ] Consulted: @dennis106 @gdoud 
- [ ] Informed: @mpreuss22 

## In scope

Add the `saasTrialProjectImport` events to those buttons. But as we did in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/buyer-experience/-/issues/361, we should change this event to `projectImport`, since the form is shown to regular user sign ups as well as trial sign ups. 

We can use the `trial_onboarding_flow=true` parameter in the URL to filter against true/false. 

I will preserve the other data points and track `'projectImport': '[PLATFORM]'` as we were before for which platform people click. 

## Requirements
What are the requirements for this request? Checklist below is an example of common requirements, please check all that apply and adjust as necessary:

- [ ] Copy writing
- [ ] Illustration
- [ ] Custom Graphics
- [x] Research
- [x] Data / Analytics
- [ ] UX Design
- [x] Engineering

title: ENG: /company/culture page is trying to render from Nuxt even though it only exists in www
description:
Because we have a /company/culture/all-remote page, Nuxt thinks that [/company/culture](https://about.gitlab.com/company/culture/) is an existing path even though we technically don't have a page for that created in this repository. It currently is rendering the Free Trial CTA when I think it should be rendering the page from www-gitlab-com.

We should be able to add 'content/company/culture' to the route.ignore.js file in our project.

title: Document development process for Slippers and Buyer Experience
description:
## Goal
We would like to document the process for using Slippers in the Buyer Experience repository after https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/buyer-experience/-/merge_requests/187. 

What is the process for adding a new variable? 
What is the process for changing an existing variable? 
When do we bump the Slippers version and how do we pull that into the Buyer Experience repository? 


### Jobs To Be Done
* **Situation**: *When Digital Experience engineers use Slippers in the Buyer Experience repository, there use documentation available on how the two repositories work together.*

title: Add social share image to Dunelm customer case study
description:
## Goal
Hi DEX team! We (Customer Advocacy + Content) would like to add the image below as the social sharing image on the [Dunelm customer case study](https://about.gitlab.com/customers/dunelm/). I tried to do this through the CMS but was unable to (probably because I don't have merge rights). I was also struggling to open an MR for this via the web IDE. Please let me know if there is a better way to submit this request.

![dunelm-social-image-1200x628](/uploads/ecaf05ba2b9ee8409e63224799efdcac/dunelm-social-image-1200x628.jpg)

#### Jobs To Be Done
* **Situation**: *When ...* the case study is shared on social media
* **Motivation**: *We want to ...* have a custom image displayed withe customer logo
* **Outcome**: *So we can ...* increase engagement on social media as measured by clicks to the website

#### Please provide more information related to this request

**If this is urgent, what is the business need for the urgency?**
- [ ]  Yes
- [x]  No: Not particularly urgent. The case study is already live, so it would be great to have the image swapped out when the team has bandwidth.

**Does anyone in leadership have eyes on this project?**
- [ ]  Yes
- [x]  No

**Compliance / legal / accessibility regulations to be aware of?**
- [ ] Yes
- [x] No: The case study content is already approved and published

**What is the ultimate end goal vision vs the MVC1 iteration?**
 - Improve the appearance of the case study when shared on social media. Going forward, the Content team will have templates that we will use to generate these images, and we will upload them via the CMS before the case study is published.

**How do we measure success?**
 - Traffic from social media

**What analytics / data will we need to set-up?**
- [ ] Yes
- [x] No

title: [Eng] Adding Culture Video to GitLab Careers Site
description:
## Goal
We would like to add our [culture video](https://vimeo.com/gitlab/lifeatgitlab) (housed in Vimeo and approved by Digital Production & Brand) to replace the team tanuki mosaic on our [jobs page](https://about.gitlab.com/jobs/) which will provide page viewers insight into what it's like to work at GitLab from perspectives of our own team members and learn more about the work that we do here. ![Screenshot_2022-11-30_at_9.32.57_AM](/uploads/c2467f93c5648b42f85cbd0e510ef48e/Screenshot_2022-11-30_at_9.32.57_AM.png)

#### Jobs To Be Done
* **Situation**: Add new [Life at GitLab video](https://vimeo.com/gitlab/lifeatgitlab) to our careers page 
* **Motivation**: We want to better inform candidates about what it's like to work at GitLab
* **Outcome**: To interest them in a career here and to click "apply"

#### Please provide more information related to this request
Make sure the information you provide is relevant for your request. If unsure, please provide all the fields. Add/remove rows as needed.

- [ ]  No

- [ ]  No

title: Updates to VSM pages, Add DORA page links
description:
## Goal
We would like to update the VSM page with links to the new [DORA page](https://about.gitlab.com/solutions/value-stream-management/dora/), as this would enable users to find more information about value stream metrics and understand how GitLab can help them become high performers.

#### Jobs To Be Done
* **Situation**: *When a user lands on the VSM page and has read the initial introduction*
* **Motivation**: *We want to present to this user, a means to go deeper into understanding more about the Value Stream metrics, and in particular the DORA metrics. *
* **Outcome**: *So we can lead the user to a page where they can go deeper into different DORA metrics, and explore DORA related resources *

We would like to define what pages are translated in the Smartling GDN.

description:
## Goal
Run the changelog and version script at the end of the iteration from Nov 21 - Dec 4

1. Go to **Buyers Experience -> CI/CD -> Jobs**

title: Update Fastly to serve /fr-fr/ from Smartling
description:
## Goal
We would like to initiate a production change to Fastly for about.gitlab.com that does the followingl

Add a rule for req.url \~"^/fr-fr", configure the origin to be `gitlab.sl.smartling.com`

This issue will be similar to [the change we made here for the POC](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/gl-infra/production/-/issues/7917). However, this will be doing 1 language at a time.

title: GA: OneTrust Country ID for docs.gitlab.com
description: ## Goal Related note: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/buyer-experience/-/issues/997#note_1025872795 Recent laws were passed that declared Google Analytics illegal since EU data is processed on a US server. Turn off Google Analytics entirely in Denmark, Austria, France, Italy and Norway. Please refer to this OneTrust Geolocation Exposure script: https://community.cookiepro.com/s/article/UUID-f1caf6bb-0003-8e79-6caf-2a7d04e357d7?language=en_US This line will grab the country ID from OneTrust: `var country = options.country.toString();` The geolocation script is already on placed: Please place the following code before the GTM script, but after the Geolocation Exposure script on all about.gitlab.com pages. ``` ``` For QA, type in "dataLayer" in console on Dev Mode. The `OneTrustCountryLoad` event name and the correlated country ID should populate. If you're in the US, you should see `US`. This dataLayer event should fire on all pages. ## DCI [DRI, Consulted, Informed](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/people-group/directly-responsible-individuals/#dri-consulted-informed-dci) - [ ] DRI: TBD - [ ] Consulted: @laurenbarker @dennischarukulvanich - [ ] Informed: @mpreuss22 @christinelee ## Requirements What are the requirements for this request? title: Fix styling on the Get Started template
description:
## Goal
We would like to fix the styling on the Get Started template which will be used for multiple pages. 

### Describe the Bug
Many of the styles used on the page are not using Slippers - all the fonts feel very large and the grid is off. 

These fixes need to be applied to both `/enterprise` and `/small-business`

| Comment | In production | In design | 
| ------ | ------ | ------ |
| Make completion estimator Body 3 Regular, not all caps | ![image](/uploads/31602d8adf26987434451b7fc18a0d65/image.png) | ![image](/uploads/3380a8da0e00d2e99376d23733197416/image.png) | 
| Make subheading H4, not H3. | ![image](/uploads/ed47f68f2f341a35f59469ee8edf263a/image.png) | ![image](/uploads/53edb975e65f6cc8412b22557c2aff70/image.png) |
| Make "Before you start" text H4 and Body 1. | ![image](/uploads/907ecd35c9f772cd428d5708172af518/image.png) | ![image](/uploads/43ea56d13cefe2e239134217b072a856/image.png) |
| Follow our grid | ![image](/uploads/0d7bf8c2cf6c6a9c1d068d383a2e1cea/image.png) | ![image](/uploads/ae22c744e048487920523982909f70b4/image.png) |
| Make headers for sections with our [Slippers component](https://www.figma.com/file/nWIOpmuMp7RZXmfTj6ujAF/Slippers_foundations?node-id=9230%3A16983&t=85GA47Sg0sF3Zyt7-1). Should be H2. | ![image](/uploads/d416f7a09464946dfd837121a5f48ee7/image.png) | ![image](/uploads/9aacc12b83d5f4e09706b7d21a86181d/image.png) |
| For accordions, use [slippers](https://www.figma.com/file/nWIOpmuMp7RZXmfTj6ujAF/Slippers_foundations?node-id=12327%3A13992&t=85GA47Sg0sF3Zyt7-1). | ![image](/uploads/d95f871277805f3afd00f9b4a4029ffe/image.png) | ![image](/uploads/9b2a4268ed31f7dc09937aac076e80f9/image.png) |
| Update fonts to match figma. | ![image](/uploads/efa3cadf1596efda47a5913add25b954/image.png) | ![image](/uploads/ba380a1e1bfb90e66b8dfd237da10b5c/image.png) |

### What's my browser? 
https://www.whatsmybrowser.org/b/M4Q7W

## Page(s)

* [Get started for small business](https://about.gitlab.com/get-started/small-business/) 
* [Get started for enterprise](https://about.gitlab.com/get-started/enterprise/)
* [Figma](https://www.figma.com/file/3n0nVcktFGeJd5m874qW1y/Get-Started?node-id=368%3A3068&t=iJNYJwJrsINs0ltB-1)

title: Optimize Buyer Experience XML Sitemap
description:
## Goal
We would like to ensure the sitemap is clear of errors and irrelevant pages which will improve crawling and indexing..

#### Jobs To Be Done
* **Situation**: *The `/buyer-experience/sitemap.xml` contains redirected links and blank pages caused by  template error*
* **Motivation**: *XML Sitemap should only contain URLs you wish for search engines to index*
* **Outcome**: *So we can prevent search engines ignoring the sitemap when crawling and indexing*

#### Please provide more information related to this request
Make sure the information you provide is relevant for your request. If unsure, please provide all the fields. Add/remove rows as needed.

**If this is urgent, what is the business need for the urgency?**
- [ ]  Yes: `Errors in the sitemap might result in search engines not trusting the sitemap.xml file which is used for crawling and indexing. Pages with no search value `

If the requestor is not the DRI, find out if the DRI is aware of the request / wants to change things.


**What is the ultimate end goal vision vs the MVC1 iteration?**
 - `A clean sitemap clear of errors and irrelevant pages`

**How do we measure success?**
 - `sitemap.xml only contain relevant URLs with 200 status code`

## Page(s)
Which page(s) are involved in this request?
* `[N/A](https://about.gitlab.com/fifteen/)` redirect to `https://page.gitlab.com/fifteen`
* `[undefined](https://about.gitlab.com/features/related-data/)`
* `[undefined](https://about.gitlab.com/features/categories/)` 
* `[undefined](https://about.gitlab.com/features/features-cta-section/)` 
* `[undefined](https://about.gitlab.com/features/features/)` 

The `/features/` URLs are blank pages with no content, crawled and indexed in Google search, contains duplicate meta title and descriptions.

## DCI
[DRI, Consulted, Informed](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/people-group/directly-responsible-individuals/#dri-consulted-informed-dci)

- [ ] DRI: `GitLab Handle`
- [ ] Consulted: `GitLab Handle`
- [ ] Informed: `Everyone`

## In scope
What is within scope of this request?

- [ ] Remove redirects in `/buyer-experience/sitemap.xml`
- [ ] Remove irrelevant pages in `/buyer-experience/sitemap.xml`

title: ENG: Automatic version bumping, changelog creation and tag creation
description:
## Goal
We would like to automate the project version bumping and the tag creation following [semantic-versioning](https://semver.org/)

#### Jobs To Be Done
* **Situation**: When we merge a new feature/fix/change into the `main` branch
* **Motivation**: We want to raise the version of the project and create a tag with this new version (i.e v1.0.0)
* **Outcome**: So we can have a consistent project tagging and versioning and also be able to update the changelog file

#### Please provide more information related to this request
Make sure the information you provide is relevant for your request. If unsure, please provide all the fields. Add/remove rows as needed.

**If this is urgent, what is the business need for the urgency?**

- [X]  Yes @laurenbarker 
- [ ]  No

**Compliance / legal / accessibility regulations to be aware of?**
- [ ] Yes: `Please describe why`
- [X] No: `Please describe why`

**What is the ultimate end goal vision vs the MVC1 iteration?**
 - Bump the package.json version and create a tag with the new version automatically

**How do we measure success?**
 - When merging a new change in the `main` branch, a new tag with the new version of the project is created automatically

**What analytics / data will we need to set-up?**

title: Move away from the SideNavigationVariant being absolutely positioned
description:
## Goal

Right now, the Side Navigation component does not take up any space in the DOM. We would like to change this to a flex container that takes up a certain amount of columns in `SlpRow`.

WIP Proposal
```vue
<SideNavParent>
  <SideNav>
    // side nav content here
  </SideNav>
  <SideNavChildren>
    // children of side nav
  </SideNavChildren>
</SideNavParent>
```
## In Scope
Cleaning up the styles will be a lot of work across various templates.

title: Add html validator to mitigate hydration errors
description:
## Goal
We are starting to wrap more components in <client-only> tags to force client side rendering, as a solution for invalid html markup. The [nuxt/html-validator library](https://html-validator.nuxtjs.org/) is a dev tool to point out potential invalid html markup. The goal is to implement this tool in dev mode only, to catch common hydration errors.

title: Why Pricing Pages - Safari - Mobile Breakpoint + Sidebar
description:
## Goal
We would like to ensure the sidebar navigation behaves correctly on smaller Safari viewports. Users need to be able to read the main content.

### Describe the Bug
In safari, when you make the viewport narrower than 1024px the nav switches to the mobile version. On the Why Ultimate and Why Premium pricing pages, there's a sidebar navigation that floats out from the right side and begins to overlap the content. As the screen gets smaller, the conent becomes unreadable because the sidebar nav is laying ontop. 

![Screen_Shot_2022-11-03_at_9.09.04_AM](/uploads/f071a6d5fa257667f06405114a3e3740/Screen_Shot_2022-11-03_at_9.09.04_AM.png)

I discovered this while QA testing the [2.0 navigation MR for BE](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/buyer-experience/-/merge_requests/1271). These pages are now linked to directly from the footer. 

But since this is a current bug in production, it's not blocking to the release of the 2.0 nav.

This is probably the case on other pages using that sidebar component.

### What's my browser? 
https://www.whatsmybrowser.org/b/GSXCV

## Page(s)
Which page(s) are involved in this request?
* https://about.gitlab.com/pricing/premium/
* https://about.gitlab.com/pricing/ultimate/

title: ENG: Replace all instances of all-caps with title-case
description:
## Goal
Our `all-caps` type is off brand and we should replace it with `title-case`. Instances using the `SlpTypography` `all-caps` variant have been identified, but we should do further research as part of this issue as to where `text-transform: uppercase` might be being used as an alternative and change those if applicable.

Related: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/buyer-experience/-/issues/1554

Additional context: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/slippers-ui/-/issues/236#note_1156356616


**What is the ultimate end goal vision vs the MVC1 iteration?**
 - The end goal for this iteration is that there are no instance of `all-caps` or similar `uppercase` style type across Buyer Experience - they should be replaced with a different type style.


## File(s)
The following files have instances of `all-caps` but this does NOT include instances of `text-transform: uppercase`.

<details><summary>Click to expand</summary>

1. `/common/blog-cards.vue`
1. `/common/event-card.vue`
1. `/common/side-navigation.vue`
1. `/customers/blog-card.vue`
1. `/customers/casestudy-card.vue`
1. `/events/event-card.vue`
1. `/events/carousel/carousel-card.vue`
1. `/features/feature-get-started.vue`
1. `/features/features-filter.vue`
1. `/features/features-product-category-cards.vue`
1. `/home/resource-cards.vue`
1. `/partners/technology-partners/platform-section.vue`
1. `/pricing/plans/feature-item-card.vue`
1. `/solutions/carousel-video-card.vue`
1. `/solutions/resource-cards-video-card.vue`
1. `/solutions/resource-cards.vue`
1. `/solutions/solutions-cards.vue`
1. `/solutions/video-card.vue`
1. `/solutions/by-solution/by-solution-value-prop.vue`
1. `/ten/event-card.vue`
1. `/topics/header.vue` (2x)
1. `/why/case-studies.vue`
1. `/platform.vue` (page)
1. `/install.vue` (page)
1. `/learn.vue` (page)
1. `/pricing.vue` (page)
1. `support/_support.vue` (page template)
1. `/support` (page)
</details>

## Updates

<details><summary>Click to expand</summary>

| Update | Visual |
| ------ | ------ |
| [Cards](https://www.figma.com/file/nWIOpmuMp7RZXmfTj6ujAF/Slippers_foundations?node-id=5581%3A12428): replace all-caps with `Body/Regular/2 (sm)`       |    ![image](/uploads/4e0079f87be42882f1fdc1874dfddf3f/image.png)    |
| [Side Navigation - Variant 2](https://www.figma.com/file/nWIOpmuMp7RZXmfTj6ujAF/Slippers_foundations?node-id=12089%3A13788): replace all-caps with `Body/Bold/3 (xs-bold)`       |    ![image](/uploads/5a8e330ec961b240f80dfc1e73e7a28a/image.png)    |
| [Side Navigation](https://www.figma.com/file/nWIOpmuMp7RZXmfTj6ujAF/Slippers_foundations?node-id=9248%3A17115): replace all-caps with `Body/Bold/3 (xs-bold)` | ![image](/uploads/9f5d6e1dc3c12be643eaaa5dd8fbea12/image.png) |

</details>

title: Major Duplication on FR subfolder
description:
## Goal
We would like to address a major duplication error on our website which might have a negative effect on SEO if not addressed urgently.

#### Jobs To Be Done
* **Situation**: *Major duplication caused by a technical error*
* **Motivation**: *Remove all duplicates*
* **Outcome**: *So we can prevent Google from penalizing our website and protect our organic traffic*

#### Please provide more information related to this request
Make sure the information you provide is relevant for your request. If unsure, please provide all the fields. Add/remove rows as needed.

Our SEO monitoring tool has detected an increase in page title changes, meta description changes and newly created pages in the /fr-fr/ folder. On closer inspection it seems like a majority of about.gitlab.com pages are duplicated in the `/fr-fr/` folder. 

**For example:**
- Direction - https://about.gitlab.com/fr-fr/direction/ops/
- Security - https://about.gitlab.com/fr-fr/security/cap/
- Solutions - https://about.gitlab.com/fr-fr/solutions/kubernetes/
- Blog - https://about.gitlab.com/fr-fr/blog/2016/09/26/infrastructure-update/
- Topics - https://about.gitlab.com/fr-fr/topics/gitops/ 

At the time of creating this issue, over [1700 duplicate pages are now indexed in Google](https://www.google.com/search?q=site%3Aabout.gitlab.com%2Ffr-fr%2F&rlz=1C5CHFA_enGB900GB900&biw=1280&bih=919&sxsrf=ALiCzsYafVY9WQdboMx1Vxx02vAmwHZVBQ%3A1666953051190&ei=W69bY8WgC4eWhbIPp8OWsAE&ved=0ahUKEwiFuuSD3IL7AhUHS0EAHaehBRYQ4dUDCA8&uact=5&oq=site%3Aabout.gitlab.com%2Ffr-fr%2F&gs_lcp=Cgxnd3Mtd2l6LXNlcnAQA0oECEEYAUoECEYYAFCqB1iqB2C9CGgBcAB4AIABRIgBRJIBATGYAQCgAQHAAQE&sclient=gws-wiz-serp) which is a major concern.

### Duplicate Content SEO Implications

Duplicate content is when you have URLs that have identical HTML content to at least one other indexable URL. If this sort of duplication occurs, you have a relatively serious issue, whereby URLs with identical content are accessible to search engine crawlers. If this results in large scale duplicate content issues on the site, you could trip quality algorithms like Google's Panda, which can depress organic search traffic to the site as a whole.


**If this is urgent, what is the business need for the urgency?**
- [ ]  Yes: `Prevent Google from penalizing our website`

If the requestor is not the DRI, find out if the DRI is aware of the request / wants to change things.

**What is the ultimate end goal vision vs the MVC1 iteration?**
 - End goal for this MVC iteration is to removal all duplicate pages

**How do we measure success?**
 - Reduction in duplicate pages indexed in Google.

## Page(s)
Which page(s) are involved in this request?
* Pages in the `/fr-fr/` folder

[DRI, Consulted, Informed](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/people-group/directly-responsible-individuals/#dri-consulted-informed-dci)

- [ ] Informed: `Everyone`

title: [ENG] Homepage Update 'play' icon
description:
## Goal
We would like to update the icon for the What is Gitlab video to have circle around it. 

[From Sid:](https://docs.google.com/document/d/17JfStScnZmpwCFdOcNu95hhk48ScJICQTUTBaEx4ZPs/edit#) “What is GitLab” and the play icon on homepage is not clear to users this leads to a video. Suggest we modify the icon with a circle around the arrow to make it clear it’s a play button instead of a link to another page

It's just replacing the existing play icon on this button. All other functionality should remain the same. should look like this:

![Screen_Shot_2022-10-25_at_14.27.53](/uploads/02511cedc9cee24ce9e519132718bdf2/Screen_Shot_2022-10-25_at_14.27.53.png)

Note: this icon is net new, it is NOT an existing product icon, so it will need to be added manually. title: Add submit event in the combined groups/projects form GTM handling
description:
## Goal

The combined groups/projects form is [now a part of the free trial flow](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/17e-EyBU7gHIZb_C0LrTfAuncLQW6q4LsuqIQ5qh0FTo/edit#slide=id.g110748f05b3_0_42).

The [old spec](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/buyer-experience/uploads/63d466fbba4fca773f6c5a2a356a37c8/Gitlab_GTM_DataLayer_Spec_for_Free_Trial.pdf) had events handled separately for group/project forms. Now we need to combine them. 

### Jobs To Be Done

* **Situation**: *When a user goes through the sign up flow*
* **Motivation**: *We want to track the GTM events for new group and project creation*
* **Outcome**: *So we can measure the free trial*

## Page(s)

Which page(s) are involved in this request?
* `gitlab.com/users/sign_up/groups_projects/new`

## DCI

[DRI, Consulted, Informed](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/people-group/directly-responsible-individuals/#dri-consulted-informed-dci)

- [ ] DRI: @tywilliams 
- [ ] Consulted: @dennis106 @gdoud 
- [ ] Informed: @mpreuss22 

## In scope

We're going to track this as a single event and use contextual info about free trial as suggested [here](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/buyer-experience/-/issues/361#note_845647533). 

So the event should now be:

```
dataLayer.push({
  'event': 'combinedGroupProjectFormSubmit',
})
```

The URL will have `trial_onboarding_flow=true` in it if the user is coming from a free trial onboarding experience, which we can use to differentiate for trials and regular sign up flows.

## Requirements
What are the requirements for this request? Checklist below is an example of common requirements, please check all that apply and adjust as necessary:

- [ ] Copy writing
- [ ] Illustration
- [ ] Custom Graphics
- [x] Research
- [x] Data / Analytics
- [ ] UX Design
- [x] Engineering

title: IA Refresh - Redirect Mapping
description:
To minimize the impact of structural change in the IA refresh we need to set up 301 redirects for deprecated and consolidated pages. We need to match your old URLs with the new ones or relevant alternatives. Without proper redirection, our new/consolidated pages will not get the traffic and PageRank of the old pages, which will affect our search engine rankings.

## Redirecting best practices
- To best preserve search rankings and traffic for better performing pages, it is best to keep the URL structure intact.
- When removing, deprecating or consolidating URLs it is important to redirect to a relevant alternative to preserve the SEO value from backlinks 
- Update internal links from the old URLs to the new URLs to prevent internal redirects which impacts crawl budget. 
- Check for existing 301 redirects to URLs that will be removed, relocated or consolidated. Updating these to the new URLs will prevent redirect chains and loops which impacts crawl budget.

## Risks
Combining, changing URLs or deprecating pages comes with risks that will affect SEO efforts. If not properly managed we run the risk of:
- Losing SEO value from backlinks attributed to removed or relocated URLs
- Drop in search traffic and rankings. It might take some time for search engines to update their search index.
- Increase in 404 errors, redirect chains and redirect loops.
- Increase in soft 404s error messages in Google Search Console.


### Tasks to be done
- [x] [Create redirect map document](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Oir6thxzoXuumbk5Lh6CBiznE6KOjJXhjQ88svKac68/edit?usp=sharing)
- [ ] Create redirects (old to new) in redirect.yml file
- [ ] Update internal links to reduce internal redirects
