title: IA Refresh Content Audit
description:
## Goal
Carry out a content audit to suggest what pages should be kept, deleted, consolidated or redirected in the website refresh. This will be compiled using backlinks, existing website structure and Google Analytics data. 

## DCI
[DRI, Consulted, Informed](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/people-group/directly-responsible-individuals/#dri-consulted-informed-dci)

- [ ] DRI: @hsmith-watson 
- [ ] Consulted: @ncregan 
- [ ] Informed: `Everyone`

## In scope
What is within scope of this request?

- [x] Content audit of current marketing pages


## Out of scope
What is out of scope and not part of this iteration?

- Blog posts and releases
- Handbook, Direction, Company and Job Families pages


## Documentation
- [Content Audit Spreadsheet](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1fCyFV8gHQrE2EWDZNr801RMJiPTIIG-Wcrvd_sPadSM/edit?usp=sharing)

### Outcomes
Based on the results of the content audit we have four suggested outcomes.

**Leave as is**

No need to delete or redirect. The page has good traffic and a healthy backlink profile. Removing these pages will have a negative impact on traffic. 
If deleted we must redirect to an alternative page and 301 redirect to ensure the link equity is maintained. 

**Redirect or Update**

The page gets no meaningful traffic but has at least 1 backlink. This needs to be manually reviewed by code owners/departments to ensure nothing of strategic value is removed.

Options:
- Improve SEO by updating the content
- Merge content with similar page and redirect to new location
- Delete page and redirect to alternative

**Manual review**

Pages with OK traffic and little from organic search. This needs to be manually reviewed by code owners/departments to ensure nothing of strategic value is removed.

Options:
- Leave as is
- Improve SEO by updating the content
- Merge content with similar page 
- Delete page and redirect to alternative

**Delete Page**

These pages has no meaningful traffic from any source and no backlinks. This needs to be manually reviewed by code owners/departments to ensure nothing of strategic value is removed.

Options:
- Delete page and redirect to alternative

title: UX: Content Gathering for IA Refresh
description:
## Goal
The experience for buyers on about.gitlab.com is not customer-centric. The Marketing Site is unfocused with too many pages and not enough structure. Starting with a refreshed information architecture that aligns with the awareness, consideration, conversion, marketing funnel prospective customers will be able to engage more fluidly.

Simplifying the experience and increasing the signal we collect from buyer actions will maximize the conversion opportunity our traffic presents.

Full memo: [FY23 Digital Experience Direction](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1LtwKyvWKerqnh6VMnbxgDxuqSb6BfI92Cr7y-2LIJEI/edit)

### Jobs To Be Done
* **Situation**: *When thinking about the information architecture refresh for the marketing site*
* **Motivation**: *we want to understand what content/pages already exist and what needs to be created...*
* **Outcome**: *so we can start working on content creation and editing.*

## Page(s)
Which page(s) are involved in this request?
* [New marketing site IA spreadsheet](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1ualGLPCyFjEpiskrfAe2ftqoTAw8t56lO1LMzMT7Ojo/edit?usp=sharing)

## DCI
[DRI, Consulted, Informed](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/people-group/directly-responsible-individuals/#dri-consulted-informed-dci)

- [ ] DRI: @jhalloran 
- [ ] Consulted: @mpreuss22 @cblake @Tinaliseng 
- [ ] Informed: `Everyone`

## In scope
What is within scope of this request?

- [x] Understand which pages already exist and link them to the spreadsheet
- [x] If multiple pages exist that could be turned into one, list them all out
- [ ] Create issues for net new content where necessary
- [ ] Create issues for updating or combining content where necessary
- [ ] Formulate a plan to write, edit, and implement content to coincide with the IA refresh timeline

title: Topics Template Layout Changes
description:
We've have looking at the recently migrated CI/CD topics page and we have identified a few changes and issues (listed below) that may have a negative impact on our current and future SEO efforts. ### Topic Navigation Links All the "More on this topic" links are external and in most cases the link is irrelevant to the topic. Before the switch these were all internal. This can be amended but we need to ensure we preserve all internal links when migrating. ### Heading Heirachy Headings gives search engines important clues about the page structure and relevancy. headings should be logically structured, starting with a h1 followed by h2's, and subsequent h3's fir related subsections, etc. The current structure isn't in a logical order. Search engines utilse header structures to decipher the informational structure and topical hierarchy of a page. For example: - `

Continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD)

`. This should be **H1**. - `

What is CI/CD?

`. This should be **H2**. ### FAQ schema The FAQ schema.org markup is missing from the page. This was implemented to make search engine better understand page contents and display the pages in the form of Rich Snippets in SERPs. ### Self referencing canonical path Self referencing canonical path is missing from this page and other pages that have migrated. This is needed to prevent search engines from indexing URLs with tracking parameters. Search performance is not affected but tracking statistics will be skewed. Search clicks will be wrongly attributed to other marketing activities in Google Analytics or other tracking tools.

title: Migrate all Typography components
description:
## Goal
Convert all the text in the Buyer Experience repo to be wrapped in <SlpTypography> components. When using the component you must select the variant from a predefined list that has been curated by Slippers. The component also automatically adjusts the text size based on screen size and allows us to handle any internationalization efforts in the future. Text needs to read from right to left, text needs to be truncated etc.

title: Migrate all Button components
description:
## Goal
Replace all <SlpButton> components in the Buyer Experience repo to use <SlpButton> from slippers-ui.


**Storybook:** https://gitlab-com.gitlab.io/marketing/digital-experience/slippers-ui/?path=/story/components-button--default

**Usage:** https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/slippers-ui/-/blob/main/src/components/Button/Button.stories.js

**Steps to complete:**

The slippers-ui buttons are globally imported, remove all local imports.
```
import SlpButton from '~/components/button.vue
components: {
  SlpButton,
}
```

and update the props (if they've changed). I've removed the dataGaName and dataGALocation props on the button component, I felt they were specific to our product and not all consumers of slippers-ui would need them. I'm open to adding them back, but would prefer if we added them on instantiation.

Once that's done, should be safe to remove button.vue

description:
The following discussion from !122 should be addressed:

- [ ] @laurenbarker started a [discussion](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/buyer-experience/-/merge_requests/122#note_803461115):  (+1 comment)

    > Non blocking for this MR, but I think we should scope work required to create an image specific to our Buyer Experience repository. I'm not sure that tying ourselves to the one used for `www-gitlab-com` is sustainable long term.

We should either: 

1. Create a specific image for this repository
1. Move the deploy stage back to using the Google SDK image once it supports the `-z` flag

title: Implement New LinkedIn Event-specific tracking using Insight Tag
description:
## Goal
LinkedIn recently announced that it has added a new conversion pixel. TLDR version, there is a new pixel based on an insight called an `insights tag` rather than an `event-specific` action. The insight tag is more accurate than the event tag type. [Here is a link to the LinkedIn update](https://www.linkedin.com/help/lms/answer/a425606?accountId=502663326).

### Jobs To Be Done
* **Situation**: When people visit the GitLab website, there are certain conversion events that we would like to track within LinkedIn. Noted the conversion events that we are tracking in the `Pages` section
* **Motivation**: Because we run a number of ad campaigns in LinkedIn, implementing the new tags will help our demand generation team and agency, optimize to performance of a campaign. 
* **Outcome**: We would be able to see exactly which conversion events are being completed for a campaign.

## Page(s)
Which page(s) are involved in this request?

Here are the conversion tags that we have in LinkedIn that we are looking to get implemented. I am unsure how the conversion tags have been set up in the, so unsure where on the page these need to be added. 

* Free Trial conversions - `window.lintrk('track', { conversion_id: 1111306 });`
* Webcast sign ups- `window.lintrk('track', { conversion_id: 1111314 });`
* Thank You Page For Events - `window.lintrk('track', { conversion_id: 2157650 });`
* Demo - `window.lintrk('track', { conversion_id: 1111250 });`
* Gated Asset download- `window.lintrk('track', { conversion_id: 1111282 });`
* Contact Sales - `window.lintrk('track', { conversion_id: 1111290 });`
* Public Sector - `window.lintrk('track', { conversion_id: 1111274 });`
* Newsletter - `window.lintrk('track', { conversion_id: 1111266 });`
* Live Events - `window.lintrk('track', { conversion_id: 1111258 });`

## DCI
[DRI, Consulted, Informed](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/people-group/directly-responsible-individuals/#dri-consulted-informed-dci)

- [ ] DRI: @mpreuss22 ? (Michael, I Slacked you about this and you said to tag you)
- [ ] Consulted: @mnguyen4
- [ ] Informed: @lstinson @zbadgley 

## In scope
What is within scope of this request?

- [ ] Implement LinkedIn insight tags to appropriate conversion events
- [ ] Deliverable 2

## Out of scope
What is out of scope and not part of this iteration?

- Not in scope 1
- Not in scope 2

## Requirements
What are the requirements for this request? Checklist below is an example of common requirements, please check all that apply and adjust as necessary:

- [ ] Copy writing
- [ ] Illustration
- [ ] Custom Graphics
- [ ] Research
- [x] Data / Analytics: This is to add LinkedIn Insight conversion tags to relevant conversion events on the GitLab website. This allows us to optimize our campaigns that we run in LinkedIn. 
- [ ] UX Design
- [ ] Engineering

title: Call Bizable script in product via hardcode
description:
## Goal
We would like to hardcode Bizable into the product instead of via GTM to have a consistent implementation across our sign up flow platforms. Calling Bizable via GTM also has data loss risk of 5-10%, so hardcoding it into the product eliminates that risk.

[Related thread](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/buyer-experience/-/issues/19#note_749577421) 

### The Code

`<script async='' src='//cdn.bizible.com/scripts/bizible.js'></script>`

## Where would this project happen?

#### Insert here a bulleted list containing any URLs that we'll be updating or creating:

All approved gitlab.com pages in the Trial funnel (not Product pages):

* https://gitlab.com/-/trials/new
* https://gitlab.com/-/trials/select

title: UX: User research | Why Premium? & Why Ultimate pages
description:
## Goal
When making updates to the [Why Premium?](https://about.gitlab.com/pricing/premium/) & [Why Ultimate?](https://about.gitlab.com/pricing/ultimate/) pricing pages, I want to first do research with our end users, so I can better understand how they use the current layout and what changes they would like to see.

### Jobs To Be Done
* **Situation**: *When I am considering GitLab*
* **Motivation**: *I want to easily find information about pricing*
* **Outcome**: *So I can make an informed purchasing decision.*

## Set up

#### What’s being tested?

* [Why Premium?](https://about.gitlab.com/pricing/premium/)
* [Why Ultimate?](https://about.gitlab.com/pricing/premium/)

#### How?
* https://www.usertesting.com/

- [ ] 1. Draft session: Run with 1 user and review
- [ ] 2. Duplicate test and edit (if it needs editing)
- [ ] 3. A/B tests:
    - [ ] 3.1 Test 1: 4 participants will complete tasks on the current Why Premium? page.
    - [ ] 3.2 Test 2: 4 participants will complete tasks on the current Why Ultimate? page.

#### General Questions

1. Is there anything we want to highlight?
1. Is there anything new we want to add?
1. Is there anything we can remove?

#### Research Questions

* Can users easily find the things they are looking for?
* Are users confused by how content is currently organized?
* Are there any improvements we can make to the current structure of the page?
* Are we using the best terminology?
* Is anything missing that a user would expect to be on the page?
* Is there anything on the page currently that shouldn't be there?


## DCI
[DRI, Consulted, Informed](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/people-group/directly-responsible-individuals/#dri-consulted-informed-dci)

- [ ] DRI: @Tinaliseng 
- [ ] Consulted: @jhalloran
- [ ] Informed: `Everyone`

## In scope
What is within scope of this request?

- [ ] 4 user testing sessions [Why Premium?](https://about.gitlab.com/pricing/premium/)
- [ ] 4 user testing sessions [Why Ultimate?](https://about.gitlab.com/pricing/premium/)

## Out of scope
What is out of scope and not part of this iteration?

- Highlights reel
- Analysis and summary

## Requirements
What are the requirements for this request? Checklist below is an example of common requirements, please check all that apply and adjust as necessary:

- [ ] Copy writing
- [ ] Illustration
- [ ] Custom Graphics
- [x] Research
- [ ] Data / Analytics
- [ ] UX Design
- [ ] Engineering

description:

title: ENG: Dynamic breakpoints for navigation different language support
description:
## Goal
We would like to investigate if it is feasible to create dynamic breakpoints in the navigation which will improve the experience for users who use GitLab in a language other than English as measured by not having overlapping elements.

Based on [this LogRocket session](https://app.logrocket.com/9jygng/gitlab/s/5-777d1b7e-98ed-4c5e-bd2d-d8db30e1df15/0?t=1637598795696) where the user was using GitLab in a Cyrillic language and many elements of the navigation overlapped making them difficult to read potentially unable to click.

### Jobs To Be Done
* **Situation**: *When a user uses the GitLab navigation...*
* **Motivation**: *they want to be able to easily read and click through all of the elements...*
* **Outcome**: *So that they can get wherever they need to go.*

## Page(s)
Which page(s) are involved in this request?
* Navigation (all pages)

## DCI
[DRI, Consulted, Informed](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/people-group/directly-responsible-individuals/#dri-consulted-informed-dci)

- [ ] DRI: @jgarc 
- [ ] Consulted: @jhalloran 
- [ ] Informed: `Everyone`

## In scope
What is within scope of this request?

- [ ] Discover if it is possible to create dynamic breakpoints in the navigation as text increases or decreases
- [ ] Find out the difficulty of implementing the fix if it exists

## Out of scope
What is out of scope and not part of this iteration?

- TBD

- [ ] Research

title: DSN: Improve free trial sign up experience
description:
## Goal
We would like to X which will improve Y as measured by Z.

### Jobs To Be Done
* **Situation**: *When a user wants to start a free trial...*
* **Motivation**: *They want to have an easy and seamless sign up experience...*
* **Outcome**: *So that they can start using our product quickly.*

## Page(s)
Which page(s) are involved in this request?
* [SaaS Free trial landing page](https://gitlab.com/-/trials/new?glm_content=free-trial&glm_source=about.gitlab.com)

## DCI
[DRI, Consulted, Informed](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/people-group/directly-responsible-individuals/#dri-consulted-informed-dci)

- [ ] DRI: @jhalloran 
- [ ] Consulted: `@s_awezec` `@gdoud` `@jackib` `@mkarampalas` `@Tinaliseng` 
- [ ] Informed: `@kcomoli` 

## In scope
What is within scope of this request?

Suggestions that were moved to engineering:

1. Small update to the Country form field selector in order to keep a neutral stance on geo-politics
[Issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/349333#note_820089507) & [Figma](https://www.figma.com/file/NxDRjifeVhRIVPFrTzeQdg/Free-Trial-updates?node-id=135%3A15433)
1. Navigation change from "Login" to profile icon - [MR](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/www-gitlab-com/-/merge_requests/95836)
1. Login page Free Trial breakdown by date [Figma](https://www.figma.com/file/muPxDrFbQdLLI9SAj8EXUK/Free-Trial-CTA-on-Sign-Up?node-id=119%3A10040) & ENG Issue
1. Removed pre-filled username from form field

Suggestions that still need work:

1. "Just do it" best practice [suggestions 1-6](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/buyer-experience/-/issues/213):
   1. [ ] **Autofocus on the first field**
   1. [ ] **Use specialized mobile keyboards** - label textboxes: email (type=email), telephone numbers (type=tel), URLs (type=url), and numbers (type=num)
   1. [ ] **In line validation** - show the error as soon as the user has left the field (rather than on submit), and the error should be specific
   1. [ ] **Make labels clickable** - add the input element inside its respective label element
   1. [ ] **Let users see their password** - less onerous than requiring them to type it twice and allows the user to see if typed correctly
      * [Figma example](https://www.figma.com/file/NxDRjifeVhRIVPFrTzeQdg/Free-Trial-updates?node-id=44%3A6639)
   1. [ ] **Use button text to expose the value waiting for users on the other side** - Give the user context for their actions
      * On [registration page](https://gitlab.com/-/trial_registrations/new?glm_source=about.gitlab.com&glm_content=free-trial) change "Continue" to "Create account"
      * On [start free trial page](https://gitlab.com/-/trial_registrations/new?glm_source=about.gitlab.com&glm_content=free-trial) change "Continue" to "Start free trial"
1. "Just do it" best practice [suggestion 7](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/buyer-experience/-/issues/214)
   * **Replace Sign in/up with Login/Register**
1. "Just do it" best practice [suggestion 8](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/buyer-experience/-/issues/215)
   * **Move register option to top of login page and vice versa**
1. "Just do it" best practice [suggestion 9](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/buyer-experience/-/issues/216)
   **Remember typed values between password attempts** - If the user enters their password unsuccessfully, they should not have to retype their email again. If we allow the user to see their password (https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/buyer-experience/-/issues/213), don’t erase that either – they may want to check to see if they made a typo.
1. "Just do it" best practice [suggestion 10](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/buyer-experience/-/issues/217)
   * **Remember email on the “reset password" page**
1. "Just do it" best practice [suggestion 11](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/buyer-experience/-/issues/268)
   * **Alternative suggested username** (without pre-filling the form field)

## Out of scope
What is out of scope and not part of this iteration?

- Free trial product experience

## Requirements
What are the requirements for this request? Checklist below is an example of common requirements, please check all that apply and adjust as necessary:

- [ ] Copy writing
- [ ] Illustration
- [ ] Custom Graphics
- [ ] Research
- [ ] Data / Analytics
- [x] UX Design
- [ ] Engineering

title: Add Buy Now Button to Website
description:
We have a significant eComm new transaction goal for Q4 FY22, which is 1275 total eComm transactions.  In Q3, we achieved 840 transactions.  As the Marketing DRI for eComm, I am requesting that Inbound Marketing team create a buy now button that lands a user on the eComm page.  This will allow us to directly harvest inbound organic traffic and convert it to a sale.  We estimate that buy adding this feature to the website, we can generate an additional 100 eCommerce sales per month.

**Requirements**

[Requirements document for web team review/collaboration is here.](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1i9IfkaN6nb8yuzNKET54Kj8qhloo9_fnHg8CTA6NlMU/edit?usp=sharing)

**Measurement Plan**

[Measurement Plan Document is here.](https://docs.google.com/document/d/11XHQPd4L0_yBGEqgud9gjuSEFeoHffI0z6v7v1dvh0I/edit)

title: Redirect gitlab.com/pricing To Pricing Page
description:
## Goal

### Jobs To Be Done

* **Outcome**: *So they can get to the content they're looking for*

* [Pricing Page](https://about.gitlab.com/pricing)

title: Partner page UI updates / fixes
description:
# Goal
Fix inconsistencies and update UI.

## Why
We will be pointing users to [Partners / Google Cloud](https://about.gitlab.com/partners/technology-partners/google-cloud-platform/) from the homepage hero next week. We want visitors to see a fluid and consistent design so they can feel confident about our product.

## Scope

title: Request: Add Language drop down on Resources page
description:
## Before creating an issue

- [x] I have reviewed the [Setting yourself up for success](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/inbound-marketing/digital-experience/website/#requesting-support) section of the website handbook.
- [x] I acknowledge that any content updates should also update [social media content](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/corporate-marketing/social-marketing/admin/#data-needed-on-pages-in-order-for-links-to-work-on-social-media) such as [images](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/corporate-marketing/social-marketing/#social-media-design), titles, and descriptions on relevant pages. Not doing this can negatively impact related campaigns.

## Where would this project happen?

#### Insert here a bulleted list containing any URLs that we'll be updating or creating:

- https://about.gitlab.com/resources/

## What does the request INCLUDE?

#### Insert the request here:

* Add a `Language` drop down that will filter the content by language
    * Current languages available: Japanese, Korean, French, Italian, Spanish, Portuguese, Russian, German
* Default the `Language` to English
    * Why: Currently when we enter new assets on the resources page, they appear in the order added. Defaulting to English will show only the English assets, but still allow users to easily select another language.

* Add language field on yml - https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/www-gitlab-com/-/edit/master/data/resources.yml 

#### Insert here a bulleted list containing links to any relevant resources:

Current languages available: 
* Japanese 
* Korean  
* French   
* Italian    
* Spanish   
* Portuguese     
* Russian
* German

![image](/uploads/51a3a701a6ecc83e84ee6b23c785570f/image.png)


## What does the request EXCLUDE?

#### Insert here any items that are out of scope for this iteration:

*Example: Because we need to get this out quickly, we will not be adding new styles, just updating the content.*

## Why would we do this?



#### Insert here why we want to do this:

We are generating more localized content (eBooks, whitepapers, webcasts, etc), but users do not have an easy way to filter for their preferred language on https://about.gitlab.com/resources/. 

Most of our localized content has not been added to this page, but we would like to add it.

## Who would be involved?

If you are requesting a deliverable from someone, please create a separate issue with a due date, assign it to that individual, and link it to this issue as a blocker.

Please use the R.A.C.I. framework. This includes RESPONSIBLE individuals who are discipline DRIs, a single person ACCOUNTABLE for the project (usually the requestor), a backup for when they accountable is unavailable, the CONSULTED who have knowledge and feedback to consider but not necessarily implement, and stakeholders who should be INFORMED about the project.

#### Insert here a list of people related to the project AND why you listed them.

*Example: @ brandon_lyon as responsible for engineering, @ jhalloran as responsible for UX, @ tbarr for approval, @ dmor as backup for @ tbarr, @ shanerice for analytics and SEO, @ awithers for copy direction, @ lsayers for legal department awareness*.

## When would you like it done?

If your request has multiple delivery dates, please create an epic with a separate issue for each deadline.

Dates without reason are difficult to prioritize. Without enough lead time we will be unable to meet your deadline.

#### Insert here your requested date AND why:

*Example: Our due date is X. We want to launch this page before a press release on X for a trade show that happens on Y. I have submitted this over a quarter in advance with the hope that it can be prioritized as a quarterly OKR.*

- [x] No deadline requested.
- [ ] YYYY-MM-DD-HH, insert reason.

title: Update subtitle on comparison infographic
description:
# Relevant URLs

[Tina caught a typo that's hardcoded in the Comparison Infographic component](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/www-gitlab-com/-/merge_requests/87900#note_645330744). 

We need to update the component to fix this, I think we should do the following: 

1. Make `Feature maturity comparison against set of industry standards` a prop in the component so it's configurable.
1. Make `Learn more about our scoring methodology` a prop in the component so it's configurable as well.
1. Update the component in `www-gitlab-com` to use it as such.
​
## Scope/Deliverables

- [x] Make the heading a prop
- [x] Make the scoring language a prop
- [x] Update the implementation in the `www-gitlab-com` repository.
​
## Requirements

- [ ]  Review by UX/UI
- [x]  Review by engineering

```
Text
```

title: ENG: Update All-Remote landing page
description:
## Goal
The All-Remote Team would like to bring [our main landing page](https://allremote.info) up to current content and brand standards, which will improve performance as measured by clicks.

### Jobs To Be Done
* **Situation**: *In FY22Q4*
* **Motivation**: *We want to reorganize and update the content of this page*
* **Outcome**: *So it represents GitLab well as the first engagement many people have with our brand; provides a good user experience; and facilitates more engagement with our site.*

## Before creating an issue

- [x] I have reviewed the [Setting yourself up for success](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/inbound-marketing/digital-experience/website/#requesting-support) section of the website handbook.
- [x] I acknowledge that any content updates should also update [social media content](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/corporate-marketing/social-marketing/admin/#data-needed-on-pages-in-order-for-links-to-work-on-social-media) such as [images](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/corporate-marketing/social-marketing/#social-media-design), titles, and descriptions on relevant pages. Not doing this can negatively impact related campaigns.

## Where would this project happen?

#### Insert here a bulleted list containing any URLs that we'll be updating or creating:

- https://about.gitlab.com/company/culture/all-remote/

## What does the request INCLUDE?

#### Insert the request here:

Update the All-Remote page using [the updated content document here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1O8DKXTx2_3Jk5cAluuwUelyfd-FCuPpw8EJNz4tMYgQ/edit).

#### Insert here a bulleted list containing links to any relevant resources:

See above

## What does the request EXCLUDE?

#### Insert here any items that are out of scope for this iteration:

Not creating a new page. Not creating any new content. This should use existing assets and resources.

## Why would we do this?

#### Insert here why we want to do this:

Remote work content is a major traffic driver to about.gitlab.com. We are in the top 100 pages on the site, yet we have lower engagement and click rates, lower conversion, and this page is out of date and difficult to parse. We can increase traffic and engagement by improving this page.

This is part of an ongoing effort to improve our all-remote content marketing.

description: While trying to create a jump menu on the 14.0 breaking changes post that anchor links are not properly rendering/working on new blog posts. More info: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/www-gitlab-com/-/merge_requests/83720#note_594873900

title: Mobile Usability - Text too small
description:
## Overview

The font size for the page is too small to be legible and would require mobile visitors to “pinch to zoom” in order to read. 

**Solution** - After specifying a viewport for your web pages, set your font sizes to scale properly within the viewport.

#### Example Screenshot
URL - https://about.gitlab.com/solutions/benefits-of-using-version-control/

![image](/uploads/49ca4394bdd53989d2aacec5e4bb4deb/image.png)

Screenshot taken with [Google Mobile-Friendly Test Tool](https://search.google.com/test/mobile-friendly?id=wkrb6lCQ4qF8Q_TZAa9fTQ).

### Affected URLs
Initial analysis indicates this error is predominantly found on URLs where the content elements such as tables and images are wider than the viewport.

This can be viewed on the about.gitlab.com [Google Search Console page experience report](https://search.google.com/u/1/search-console/mobile-usability/drilldown?resource_id=https%3A%2F%2Fabout.gitlab.com%2F&item_key=CAw).

title: Mobile Usability - Content wider than screen
description:
## Overview
Certain pages appears broken when viewed on a mobile device causing the user to scroll horizontally and vertically to view the content. This seems to be affecting URLs with embedded content such as buttons, images, tables and iframes that are not responsive.

### Example Screenshots

![image](/uploads/a01589d97c1745159ebd94b051d81e52/image.png)![image](/uploads/d50d2cd7393d17c8152c714c9d1bed0d/image.png)

### Solution
To fix this error, make sure the pages use relative width and position values for CSS elements, and make sure images can scale as well.

### Affected URLs
This can be viewed on the about.gitlab.com [Google Search Console page experience report](https://search.google.com/u/1/search-console/mobile-usability/drilldown?resource_id=https%3A%2F%2Fabout.gitlab.com%2F&item_key=CAk).

title: Add newsletter sign-up globally to footer
description:
<!--

This template is for requesting work to an existing webpage  [marketing website](https://about.gitlab.com/) , or logged out gitlab.com.

DO NOT use this for:
New webpages, docs.gitlab.com, the GitLab product (In app), the handbook or other items.

For information regarding working on the about website please visit the [Brand and Digital Handbook](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/inbound-marketing/digital-experience/)

TITLE THIS ISSUE: Page Update: [Your Relevant Title]
-->
## Overview

## Triage (REQUIRED)
 
**This issue fulfills one of these goals:** (Requestor check one)
- [ ] Traffic
- [x] Supports Inquries
- [ ] Conversion 
- [ ] Enable unlocks for conversion and traffic later (example CMS implementation)
   - `Add details here (required if this box is checked)` 
- [ ] Cross-functional support 
   - `Link team to OKR (required if this box is checked)` 
   
#### Briefly describe your request
What is going to be added/updated/removed, etc.

Design and add the newsletter sign-up globally to the about.gitlab.com footer 

#### Describe why this update is being requested:
What problem(s) are you trying to solve? What are the goals? Example: Users can't find what they're looking for.

Assist with Inbound Marketing Inquiries goal

## Project Management

#### Please identify the DRI, stakeholders, subject matter experts, and their roles
Who should we be asking about questions and reviews?

* A directly responsible individual (DRI) is the singular person leading this project. We will ask them for clarifications, decisions, facilitation, or other assistance.
* A stakeholder is a person who represents an entity that the project impacts. We might ask about their needs, request their feedback, or inform them when the project is complete.
* Subject matter experts (SME) will be asked questions related to their expertise. Example subjects include design, development, copy, analytics, seo, social, ops, handbook, infrastructure, technologies like Marketo, etc.
* You may insert or remove as many lines as needed to list the relevant people involved with the project and their roles.

|Name|Role|
|------|------|
| @mpreuss22  | DRI |
| @vsilverthorne   | Content SME|
| `@user2` | UX design |
| `@user3` | Development |
| @bmatturro  | Content stakeholder|
| @dmor  | Stakeholder|


#### What is the timeframe AND WHY?
Dates without reason are difficult to prioritize. Without enough lead time we will be unable to meet your deadline. Example: Our due date is XXXX-XX-XX. We want to launch this page before a trade show happens on YYYY-YY-YY. We need a week to coordinate press before the event.

*If your ask requires multiple delivery deadlines, consider creating an epic with an issue for each deadline.*

Align with Navigation updates if the footer is included, if not let's aim for mid February

## Project Deliverables

* [ ] Add newsletter sign-up form to global footer

## Related Documents/Information
Link and explain all related documents, websites, assets, logos etc. NOTE: The web team will not be able to meet deadlines unless everything is provided. [Images should follow our guidelines](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/inbound-marketing/digital-experience/image-guidelines/).

title: GA4/GTM/OneTrust Blocker
description:
## Goal

**Context**

Google Tag Manager (GTM) by itself does NOT store any cookies on the browser. When tags on GTM are configured to send data to different platforms, such as Google Analytics, Linkedin, Google Ads, etc. - that's when cookies for the associated platform are stored on the browser. Each tag already contains a OneTrust condition, and will only fire if the user consents to the specific cookie category, such as functional, performance/analytics, or targeting.

On a related note, we've added the gtag.js code update for GA4's consent feature. This update will send a signal to the browser's dataLayer regarding the user's default consent status based on their country. For example, by default (no user interaction with the consent banner at this point), a user from a European country will NOT be tracked if they take no action (clicking "X" on the OneTrust banner).

The gtag.js code update enables the machine learning capabilities for GA4 to fill in the gap where users deny tracking (by default or by choice).

[More Details](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1i66ayUZTVuff41w6IKPVeSJ_pwL1nIX4pQZbF9Gpcro/edit#)

#### Jobs To Be Done
* **Situation**: *When a user visits the site w*
* **Motivation**: *We want to load GTM at all times and prevent OneTrust from blocking *
* **Outcome**: *So we can ...*

#### Please provide more information related to this request

In attempt to prevent OT from blocking GTM we tried using `data-ot-ignore` and `optanon-category-C0001` from OneTrust's Docs. Both of these slowed down traffic to GA. A ticket was submitted to OneTrust support where they suggested that we focus on our script ordering since OneTRust loads after GTM in our codebase and that may potentially be preventing their auto blocking classes from working. In attempt to do we've tried:

- **Placing OneTrust above GTM in the head file**: no effect [[MR]](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/www-gitlab-com/-/merge_requests/108574)
- **Using the addEventListener**: Using the addEventListener method to attach a load event listener to the OneTrust script, and then include the Google Tag Manager script inside the event listener function
this prevented GTM from loading at all [[MR]](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/buyer-experience/-/merge_requests/1499)
- **Changing GTM’s Triggers to wait for OneTrust** [[MR]](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/www-gitlab-com/-/merge_requests/118462)
This was suggested by [StackOverflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/75073704/onetrust-script-executing-after-google-tag-manager). By adding another trigger that onetrust fires when it's loaded and by adding an exception to existing pageview triggers to not fire if onetrust's consent cookies are missing or denied [[MR]](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/www-gitlab-com/-/merge_requests/118462)
- **Increasing time interval on GTM attribute `wait_for_update`**:  no effect [[MR]](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/www-gitlab-com/-/merge_requests/118797)
- **Loading OneTrust from GTM:** broke the functionality in the cookie banner and prevented user preferences from persisting [(shown here)](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/www-gitlab-com/uploads/e582c4be996eae761a87d0ebb8fa65d7/video2798811226.mp4)
- **Removing GTM from the source of all cookies containing "gtm" individually in the OneTrust Dashboard**: _waiting for response from OT support_

**Does anyone in leadership have eyes on this project?**
- [x]  Yes `@laurenbarker`
- [ ]  No

## Page(s)
Which page(s) are involved in this request?

All pages, but let's start with about.gitlab.com subdomain for this issue.

## DCI
[DRI, Consulted, Informed](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/people-group/directly-responsible-individuals/#dri-consulted-informed-dci)

- [ ] Consulted: @dennischarukulvanich
- [ ] Informed: @justin.vetter @lduggan @laurenbarker @mpreuss22 @christinelee @degan @jahye1 @dmicovic

title: ENG: Refactor Software Faster Carousel Component
description:
[Software Faster page](https://about.gitlab.com/software-faster/)

The current carousel does not render all slide content on the page at once, but renders the content for the slide that's visible. This has made it difficult to render the video on slide two on page load, which is needed for Vimeo analytics to be pushed up to the dataLayer. 

Let's refactor the carousel component so that all slide content is rendered in the DOM, but is properly hidden until selected.

Related comment: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/buyer-experience/-/merge_requests/1611#note_1258247192

title: Ability to recognize logged in GitLab user
description:
## Goal
We would like to recognize when a user is logged into GitLab on the marketing site. 

The goal with this issue is to

1. Investigate how we could do this
1. Start a thread for each 'how' that gives a high-level overview, scope, & risks. We'll discuss as a team in each thread.
1. Chose a strategy. We'll determine next steps from there.

**We'll need to schedule these changes in the GDK to be before or after _March 7th_ because of the [Hard Production Change Lock](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/infrastructure/change-management/#production-change-lock-pcl) where the GDK will be updated to Ruby 3**

title: Updates to Search
description:
## Goal
We would like to update the Search. There were some features that were left off for MVC1, but we'd like to add them back to enhance the experience. 

#### Please provide more information related to this request
| Comment | In design | In production |
| ------ | ------ | ------ |
| 1. Update autocomplete to be more intelligent. It should not just serve up the suggested articles, but autocomplete/autocorrect what the user is typing. | ![image](/uploads/24c35df65235794f5306ad3231816b52/image.png) | ![image](/uploads/4de35ad8ad287ad402ab00ab3b2576dc/image.png) |
| 2. Filter by checkboxes (instead of radio buttons) | ![image](/uploads/0710617b711bd4193cf156ec0157692b/image.png) | ![image](/uploads/53d52b9dda147e7bfdfc292304b2a67a/image.png) |
| 3. Make the search results it’s own page so users can go back to their search after they’ve selected a result. Currently, if a user selects a result, they will have to go back to the page they were on before the search. |  | See [loom](https://www.loom.com/share/d2d25d7c14ca4e3c82c87e6998d428a3) |

title: Netlify CMS authentication for only members of repository
description:
## Goal
For only members of a public GitLab repository to be able to access the Netlify CMS admin. 

For our use case, this means `about.gitlab.com/admin `

Currently anyone with a GitLab account can login to the admin. We'd like to restrict access to www-gitlab-com project members. 

Here's [the slack thread in #marketing](https://gitlab.slack.com/archives/C0AKZRSQ5/p1674306562076699) that spawned this issue.

Although any account can log in, their actions are still restricted based on their permissions. For example users could see "draft posts" which are just public MRs - already visible via gitlab.com's normal UI - but they wouldn't be able to merge without Maintainer permissions. **There is no current security risk**, just confusing behavior.

#### Jobs To Be Done
* **Situation**: *When anyone tries to login to the `about.gitlab.com/admin`, only those who are project members of [www-gitlab-com](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/www-gitlab-com) should be able to authenticate successfully.*
* **Motivation**: *We want to have the admin only available to GitLab team members.*
* **Outcome**: *So that non team-members don't have access to an "admin" site.*

#### Please provide more information related to this request
Make sure the information you provide is relevant for your request. If unsure, please provide all the fields. Add/remove rows as needed.

**If this is urgent, what is the business need for the urgency?**
- [x]  Yes: `SIRT got informed that it is possible to log into the https://about.gitlab.com/admin interface with ANY GitLab account`
- [ ]  No

If the requestor is not the DRI, find out if the DRI is aware of the request / wants to change things.

- [ ]  No

title: [ENG] Add sub copy to /devops-tools page
description:
## Goal
We would like to add text to the top of the /devops-tools page to make clear that these logos are in stack-rank or prioritized order based on strength or maturity in their category.  We will also link to the /competition from here

ex:
![CleanShot_2023-01-12_at_09.49.20](/uploads/2e970338bbbb3b5ee29bfa3abcef81c7/CleanShot_2023-01-12_at_09.49.20.jpg)

### Final Copy: 
1. H1: DevOps tools landscape (should be sentence case instead of title case as it currently is)
2. H5: As The DevSecOps Platform, GitLab’s focus is on providing a single application with best-in-class capabilities for the entire DevOps lifecycle.
3. Body-2: There are a ton of DevOps tools to choose from, many of which specialize in a few capabilities. We’ve ranked the tools for each stage of the DevOps lifecycle, starting with the most mature solutions. For more info on the maturity of GitLab and other key competitors, check out our DevOps maturity comparison chart.
4. Add a title to the table - H4: Top tools for each stage of the DevOps lifecycle

- [Google doc](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1WefXucnXBi09wBv_ho7mBQ-BKc0WaeTFjYh7-TUWkkI/edit?usp=sharing)
- See [comment below](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/buyer-experience/-/issues/1772#note_1237537954)

title: Enable anchor links as source for redirects
description:
## Goal
We would like to enable anchor links to be the `source` for redirects. 

We discovered this functionality didn't work when implementing redirects for the support pages [here](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/www-gitlab-com/-/merge_requests/116174#note_1215292915). 

Another example is [this one](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/www-gitlab-com/-/blob/master/data/redirects.yml#L1302) which also doesn't work.

```yaml
- sources:
  - /handbook/finance/procurement/#prior-to-contacting-procurement
  - /handbook/finance/procurement/#prior-to-contacting-procurement/
  - /handbook/finance/procurement/prior-to-contacting-procurement/
  - /handbook/finance/procurement/prior-to-contacting-procurement
  target: /handbook/finance/procurement/vendor-selection-process/
  comp_op: '='
``` 

#### Jobs To Be Done
* **Situation**: *We wan't to enable anchor links to be the source for redirects*
* **Motivation**: *We want to redirect users to the correct place*
* **Outcome**: *So we can get them to the right place*

#### Please provide more information related to this request
Make sure the information you provide is relevant for your request. If unsure, please provide all the fields. Add/remove rows as needed.

- [x]  No

If the requestor is not the DRI, find out if the DRI is aware of the request / wants to change things.

## In scope

- [ ] Implement functionality and verify it works on existing redirects

title: ENG: Pricing/licensing-faq Refresh
description:
## Goal
The /licensing-faq page is a feeder page into the /pricing/ page and currently looks like a handbook page. There is an opportunity to improve this page to be more conversion-focused. We would like to redesign /pricing/licensing-faq/ which will improve user experience. 

### Notes
There is currently no slippers component for the accordion. We would like to have this page updated using a BE accordion component now and we will iterate to the slippers component in Q4

#### Jobs To Be Done
* **Situation**: *When users land on the licensing page*
* **Motivation**: *We want to provide them the information they are looking for*
* **Outcome**: *So we can eventually lead them to a free trial *

## Workin Files
- [ ] [Figma design](https://www.figma.com/file/I1RYrS4BtJEvS1rpRJvgBa/Licensing-FAQ-MVC1?node-id=53%3A5419)

- [X]  Yes: There is a gap to plan in free trial conversions. 
- [ ]  No

- [X] No: `Please describe why`

 - Increased session duration 
 - Increased clicks to free trial

title: ENG: Solutions / Change 'Take GitLab for a Spin' copy
description:
## Goal
I would like to iterate on the line `Take GitLab for a Spin` which will improve clicks as measured by metrics.

This section has the lowest engagement on the page ([source](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/buyer-experience/-/issues/1375#note_1118351358)) so we would like to test an alternative line of copy. I hypothesize that 'Take GitLab for a Spin' is both too vague and too aggressive. I would like to replace the line with `Try Ultimate for Free` which is a more clear and more succinct call to action.

<details><summary>Current</summary>
![Screen_Shot_2022-10-12_at_3.14.20_PM](/uploads/5c5f0471e3af93d69fc8218a9a84fa35/Screen_Shot_2022-10-12_at_3.14.20_PM.png)
</details>

<details><summary>Updated</summary>
![Screen_Shot_2022-10-12_at_3.14.04_PM](/uploads/af737cc463d58218fa1cacee548b96b6/Screen_Shot_2022-10-12_at_3.14.04_PM.png)
</details>

### Technical details
The current <NextStep/> component uses a universal yml file for all of the content across the site.  We will need to modify the component to look for data coming from the page yml file and have a fallback to use the current universal yml file. 

## Page(s)
Which page(s) are involved in this request?
1. All /solution child pages 
1. https://about.gitlab.com/solutions

## In scope
What is within scope of this request?

- [ ] Modify the current <NextStep> component to accept page data with a fall back to use the current universal yml file
- [ ] Replace ~~Take GitLab for a Spin~~ with `Try Ultimate for Free` on /solutions and /solution child pages

## DCI
[DRI, Consulted, Informed](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/people-group/directly-responsible-individuals/#dri-consulted-informed-dci)

- [ ] DRI: `GitLab Handle`
- [ ] Consulted: @Tinaliseng @dennischarukulvanich 
- [ ] Informed: @justin.vetter

title: ENG: Fix render blocking for Google fonts
description:
## Goal
We would like to increase our core web vital scores.  One of the line items that is hurting our scores is how Google fonts is loaded.

![CleanShot_2022-10-04_at_10.23.26](/uploads/f0c22811b237a6bf3b39a9270e6a8e02/CleanShot_2022-10-04_at_10.23.26.jpg)


#### Jobs To Be Done
* **Situation**: *When the DOM loads google fonts is blocking page render lowering our core vital score*
* **Motivation**: *We want to update to fix our core vital scores*
* **Outcome**: *So we can show increased core vital score*

#### Please provide more information related to this request
Here are two articles talking about how to resolve this issue
- https://dieppa.co.uk/2020/10/21/eliminate-render-blocking-resources-google-fonts/
- https://www.tutorialjinni.com/eliminate-render-blocking-google-fonts.html

We will need to test to see if we are seeing major font popping with these options, and weigh the benefit of this change.

**If this is urgent, what is the business need for the urgency?**
- [ ]  Yes: `what is the business need for the urgency`
- [x]  No

title: Header & Footer JS package size non BE repo
description:
## Goal
I would like to discuss the JS package size for the main nav and footer.  In the handbook, blog, and non-BE www pages these two js files are usually the largest load on the page.

When the Nav repo is added to BE our webpack does some smart splitting on what is loaded and when, but not when we just load in the files.

title: Document visual changes on the website since rebrand
description:
From Michael:
- Put together a list of URLs and before and after screenshots of all page refreshes we’ve done since Q2

title: Add LaunchDarkly users to DEX handbook
description: Let's add the names of DEX team members who have access to LaunchDarkly to our handbook. Not everyone on our team may have access and this transparency will speed up the process of finding someone that may have access in order to answer questions, grab data, grant additional access, etc.

title: Tracking: Site Search Result dataLayer
description:
## Goal Objective is to push a dataLayer event when a search is made, along with the searched query. Push dataLayer on search result load
``` dataLayer.push({ 'event': 'siteSearchResult', 'siteSearchQuery': '[dynamic searched query goes here]' }); ``` Note: The dataLayer should be pushed when the user enters a query in the search field AND when the user clicks on a suggested searched query - both methods will lead the user to the result page as a next step. #### Please provide more information related to this request
Make sure the information you provide is relevant for your request. If unsure, please provide all the fields. title: Smarting GDN Localization Proof of Concept for French, Japanese, and German
description:
## Goal

Proof of Concept localized versions of conversion driving pages using the [Smartling Global Delivery Network](https://www.smartling.com/software/global-delivery-network/) have been created on our domain using a sandbox demo from Smartling. We'd like to gain approval from stakeholders on using this service in a production capacity for about.gitlab.com before [signing a contract with Smartling](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/marketing-operations/-/issues/7033). Proof of Concept URLS to verify are: 

**French Localization**
- https://about.gitlab.com/fr-fr/
- https://about.gitlab.com/fr-fr/why-gitlab/
- https://about.gitlab.com/fr-fr/pricing/

**Japanese Localization** 
- https://about.gitlab.com/ja-jp/
- https://about.gitlab.com/ja-jp/why-gitlab/
- https://about.gitlab.com/ja-jp/pricing/

**German Localization** 
- https://about.gitlab.com/de-de/
- https://about.gitlab.com/de-de/why-gitlab/
- https://about.gitlab.com/de-de/pricing/

We needed to make changes to our DNS to serve these our our doamin, which was coordinated here: 

Infrastructure issue for support: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/gl-infra/reliability/-/issues/16433

title: Release: Free Trial Conversion data in Launch Darkly
description:
## Goal
We would like to enable free trial conversion data to be collected by Launch Darkly.

#### Jobs To Be Done
* **Situation**: *When a user clicks on the Free Trial nav button in navigation, data is collected by Launch Darkly for each A/B navigation test variant*
* **Motivation**: *We want to measure free trick click rates of each A/B test variant*
* **Outcome**: *So we can determine a winner based on data*

#### Please provide more information related to this request
Make sure the information you provide is relevant for your request. If unsure, please provide all the fields. Add/remove rows as needed.

**If this is urgent, what is the business need for the urgency?**
- [x]  Yes: We enabled our 1st [A/B test to remove register for the nav](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/buyer-experience/-/issues/1356) on 2022-09-15. Since the test is live, we are not collecting correct data, therefore this issue is urgent. If we do not resolve this by 2022-09-16, we will need to stop and restart that A/B test.
- [ ]  No

If the requestor is not the DRI, find out if the DRI is aware of the request / wants to change things.

**Does anyone in leadership have eyes on this project?**
- [x]  Yes @laurenbarker @fqureshi 
- [ ]  No

**Compliance / legal / accessibility regulations to be aware of?**
- [ ] Yes: `Please describe why`
- [ ] No: unknown

 - Free trial clicks are measured in Launch Darkly for variant A and B of the navigation

 - Data is collected and visible through Launch Darkly

- [x] Yes: @dennischarukulvanich to verify
- [ ] No

title: Release:  Launch Darkly Flag for A/B Test - Remove 'register' from the nav
description:
## Goal
We would like to implement a Launch Darkly feature flag to run the [A/B test proposed here](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/ab-testing/-/issues/1).

This A/B test will do a 50/50 split between two nav variations - one with the register link and one with out. 

This issue is for tracking the work required to build this feature flag switch into the Buyer Experience repository and turning it on.

[A/B Test MR](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/buyer-experience/-/merge_requests/1006)
[Handbook Page Update](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/www-gitlab-com/-/merge_requests/111314)

### Jobs To Be Done
* **Situation**: *When a user visits our site, 50% get variant A of the nav and 50% get variant B*

title: Address v::deep errors on build
description:
## Goal
We would like to fix the all the `WARN  [@vue/compiler-sfc] ::v-deep ....`  errors when running the Buyer Experience project. This warning is slowing down our build and making it difficult to find errors because there are so many v-deep warnings.

### Jobs To Be Done
* **Situation**: *When the site is built locally or for production, we don't see any v::deep warnings in the console*
* **Motivation**: *We want to keep our build clean and manageable for reading errors*
* **Outcome**: *So we can be efficient when fixing build issues*

title: ENG: Adding Great Place to Work badge to GitLab careers site
description:
## Goal
We would like to add a section to the GitLab careers site that highlights we are Great Place to Work certified which will provide a proof point about what it's like to work here as measured by the ratio of site visits to applications over time.

This section was designed as part of [this issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/buyer-experience/-/issues/1267).

Here's the [figma](https://www.figma.com/file/JhFZCIRo8AoWrLIFDEOtL4/Careers?node-id=7%3A399).

Also dropping a mock for easy reference here: 
![image](/uploads/210bb71f8be0ba5761bb9b501b63088d/image.png)

### Jobs To Be Done
* Design a section for our careers page using an existing design pattern to highlight the attached badge and content provided by the talent brand team.
* The idea here is that we want people who visit our careers site to know that we are a Great Place to Work.
* So, they are more likely to apply for a job if there is an open role that's the right fit.

## Page(s)
Which page(s) are involved in this request?
* https://about.gitlab.com/jobs/

## DCI
[DRI, Consulted, Informed](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/people-group/directly-responsible-individuals/#dri-consulted-informed-dci)

- [ ] DRI: TBD
- [ ] Consulted: @laurenbarker @drogozinski 
- [ ] Informed: Devin to inform People Leadership Group, Ray/Michael to inform marketing as needed

## In scope
What is within scope of this request?

- Designing a small section to highlight our Great Place to Work certified badge and provided copy

- Creating the MR to add that new section seamlessly into the careers site.

- Provided copy: At GitLab, being a great place to work means building a workplace where everyone can contribute and anyone can thrive. We aim to uphold that ideal in every country where we employ GitLab team members.

- Button text: See our employer awards 
- Button link: <https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/people-group/employment-branding/content-library/#awards-and-lists-recognizing-gitlab-as-a-great-place-to-work>

## Requirements
What are the requirements for this request? Checklist below is an example of common requirements, please check all that apply and adjust as necessary:

- [ ] Copy writing
- [ ] Illustration
- [ ] Custom Graphics
- [ ] Research
- [ ] Data / Analytics

title: Create approval flow labels
description:
## Goal
We would like to create approval flow labels from minor to major change for all Digital Experience repositories and the www-gitlab-com repository. As part of this issue, lets define what those labels are and create them. 

### Jobs To Be Done
* **Situation**: *When a change is made to the marketing site, the correct approval label is applied to the merge request*
* **Motivation**: *We want to communicate the level of change via a label*
* **Outcome**: *The goal is for a member of GitLab’s Digital Experience team always to review an MR before it goes live on the Buyer Experience repo or key marketing pages in the www-gitlab-com repo.*

## Page(s)
Which page(s) are involved in this request?
* [Buyer Experience repository](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/buyer-experience)
* [Navigation repository](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/navigation)
* [Slippers repository](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/slippers-ui)
* [www-gitlab-com repository](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/www-gitlab-com/)

title: Contact Page: Marketo Form Fields for Google Analytics
description:
## Goal Related: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/buyer-experience/-/issues/1260#note_1086859242 Marketo forms has hidden `` fields to capture the Google Analytics client ID and tracking ID. **Method**
This script on Tag Manager fires on DOM Ready across all about.gitlab.com pages, which retrieves the IDs and appends them on the form upon a form submission:
**Example:**
On the https://about.gitlab.com/sales/ page, you can see the `gaclientid__c` and `gatrackid__c` values populate the `` fields upon a form submit:
**Engineering Issue**
There are two forms on this page: https://about.gitlab.com/company/contact/ with duplicated scripts for each form (not to mention the script on Tag Manager as well). Only the Newsletter script works, the Security one doesn't. Are there too many duplicated scripts? Or is the Security script not working properly? Also, should I pause the script on Tag Manager from firing on this page? ## Page(s) Which page(s) are involved in this request? * https://about.gitlab.com/company/contact/ ## DCI [DRI, Consulted, Informed](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/people-group/directly-responsible-individuals/#dri-consulted-informed-dci) - [ ] DRI: `GitLab Handle` - [ ] Consulted: @laurenbarker @justin.vetter - [ ] Informed: `Everyone` ## Requirements What are the requirements for this request? title: Brand marketing landing page refresh
description:
## Goal
We would like to refresh (not redesign) our brand marketing landing page with some small adjustments ([figma comp from brand design team for direction](https://www.figma.com/file/cpxpcnUjCEDH87otFP42zZ/Brand-strategy-landing-page?node-id=313%3A1599&t=vxdM0abipJEBkjqJ-1)) to better align with campaign messaging and improve engagement with our content.

Adjustments: 
- Hero: Swap out the Hero image with new creative
- Hero: Update the Watch Video CTA and link (Pending final link to "What Is GitLab?" new video).
- Hero: remove the "free trial" link to focus user engagement on the Watch video CTA and scroll down the page.
- Customer Stories: Move this module up above the logo strip to encourage discovery and engagement.
- Customer Stories: Change the module layout to present all three customer stories on the page. 

**Context for surfacing customer stories**: 
Based on 3 months of historical brand landing page data (q4FY23 - Q1FY24) our top 5 page clicks are:

1. Header / Free Trial
2. Hero / Watch Video CTA
3. Hero / Free Trial
4. Header / Site Search
5. In-line / GitLab Homepage

**Awareness level content:**

11. Read the Blog (Cadence is Everything)
12. Hackerone customer story

With the suggested minimal edits above, we believe that awareness level content will get an increased number of clicks. We will monitor this iteration and measure the results. 

#### Jobs To Be Done
* **Situation**: *Live April 5th, 2023 (possibly sooner, if edit proves minimal)*
* **Motivation**: *We will be featuring our new What is GitLab video and driving traffic to customer stories through a brand ad campaign as soon as this is refreshed.*
* **Outcome**: * Feature our new What is GitLab video and surface awareness level content (customer stories) closer to the fold*

#### Please provide more information related to this request
Make sure the information you provide is relevant for your request. If unsure, please provide all the fields. Add/remove rows as needed.

**If this is urgent, what is the business need for the urgency?**
- [x]  Yes: `See note with Situation.  We'd love to get this in market sooner if possible. Look to your team for guidance.`
- [ ]  No

If the requestor is not the DRI, find out if the DRI is aware of the request / wants to change things.

**Does anyone in leadership have eyes on this project?**
- [x]  Yes @dsteer 
- [ ]  No

**Compliance / legal / accessibility regulations to be aware of?**
- [ ] Yes: `Please describe why`
- [x] No: `video has been approved and all other changes exist within the live and approved brand landing page`

**What is the ultimate end goal vision vs the MVC1 iteration?**
 - `To add the What is GitLab? video to the brand landing page, to have our hero image mirror current digital campaign look and feel and to move customer stories closer to the fold/ top of the scroll to increase consumer engagement with awareness level content.`

**How do we measure success?**
 - `Once live we will continue to monitor engagement of the content through our brand landing page dashboard "clicks by page section."

**What analytics / data will we need to set-up?**
- [x] Yes: we'd want to update the What is GitLab video (Vimeo).  But all other page analytics should be up to date.
- [] 

## Page(s)
Which page(s) are involved in this request?
* `[Software.Faster | GitLab](https://about.gitlab.com/software-faster/)`

## DCI
[DRI, Consulted, Informed](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/people-group/directly-responsible-individuals/#dri-consulted-informed-dci)

- [x] DRI: @jmatthewj 
- [x] Consulted: @amittner @rclayman 
- [ ] Informed: `Everyone`

## In scope
What is within scope of this request?

- [x] Deliverable 1
**Edits** 
- Hero: Swap out the Hero image with new creative
- Hero: Update the Watch Video CTA and link (Pending final link to "What Is GitLab?" new video.
- Hero: remove the "free trial" link to focus user engagement on the Watch video CTA and scroll down the page.
- Customer Stories: Move this module up above the logo strip to encourage discovery and engagement.
- Customer Stories: Change the module layout to present all three customer stories on the page.

**Design / Layout**: Brand design to provide comp for [this figma design](https://www.figma.com/file/cpxpcnUjCEDH87otFP42zZ/Brand-strategy-landing-page?node-id=313%3A1599&t=vxdM0abipJEBkjqJ-1)

**Video / What Is GitLab?**: pending final edits.  Should have an update on this link EOW (3/23/23)

## Requirements
What are the requirements for this request? Checklist below is an example of common requirements, please check all that apply and adjust as necessary:

- [ ] Copy writing
- [ ] Illustration
- [ ] Custom Graphics
- [ ] Research
- [ ] Data / Analytics

- [X] Engineering

3. adds new icons

The page has high engagement with a 61% click rate. It has the 3rd highest SaaS trial conversion rate at 4.4% behind /free-trial and /pricing/feature-comparison. title: [Eng] Run A/B test V2 for sales and trial header CTAs
description:
## Goal We would like to run a A/B test on the free trial CTA in the nav. Variant 1: Default black button Variant 2: Glean black button ## In scope What is within scope of this request? - [ ] Create the black glean button in the navigation repository - [ ] Create a A/B test in Launch Darkly for testing the black glean variant - [ ] Running a successful A/B test for the nav buttons - verifying that data is collected in Launch Darkly & GTM - [ ] Determining what was wrong when we first implemented the multivariant test - [ ] Updating our [handbook](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/digital-experience/engineering-ab-tests/) with clear documentation ## Requirements What are the requirements for this request? Checklist below is an example of common requirements, please check all that apply and adjust as necessary: - [ ] Copy writing - [ ] Illustration - [ ] Custom Graphics - [ ] Research - [ ] Data / Analytics - [ ] UX Design - [x] Engineering ### Target and Split - 50/50 (primary vs steel) ### Key Performance Indicators - Trial CTA click **Metrics to monitor:** - Trial CTA click - SaaS trial signup rate ### Estimated Experiment Duration Duration Calculator: https://www.abtasty.com/sample-size-calculator/
Roughly 2-3 days ## Engineering Notes ### LaunchDarkly Please set the conversion metric to measure:
- Control: Free Trial CTA click in the header - Variant: Free Trial CTA click in the header ### Google Analytics Push the following dataLayer code before DOM ready: ``` window.dataLayer = window.dataLayer || []; dataLayer.push({ 'event': 'launchDarklyExperiment', 'launchDarklyExperimentName': 'name of experiment', 'launchDarklyExperimentId': '0 or 1' }); ``` _Where:_
- name of experiment is the dynamic name of the LaunchDarkly experiment - 0 or 1 0 = control, 1 = variant Ensure the variant `` element has the following attributes: `data-nav="free trial"`

title: Categories & Features yml breaking changes retro
description:
## Goal
We would like to discuss breaking changes to Categories.yml and features.yml files and the changes needed to fix our pipeline.

Example: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/www-gitlab-com/-/commit/d32d4177863bf6b293c937418f4126d69e30adf7

What work should be done to detect and monitor these changes?

Is there any follow-up work that needs to take place after this round of changes?

title: Automate Schema Generation for Topic pages
description:
## Goal
We would like automate the generation of schema for topics in the Buyer Experience repository..

@hsmith-watson provided a example of the schema markup to be generated [here](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/inbound-marketing/seo/-/issues/354#note_1307809427). Pasting it below as well. 

```
<script type="application/ld+json">
{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "Article",
  "mainEntityOfPage": {
    "@type": "WebPage",
    "@id": "https://about.gitlab.com/topics/devsecops/"
  },
  "headline": "What is DevSecOps?",
  "description": "Effectively turn your DevOps methodology into a DevSecOps methodology",
  "image": "https://about.gitlab.com/_nuxt/image/da4ee5.png",
  "articleSection":"DevSecOps",
  "timeRequired":"PT05M",
  "author": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "GitLab",
    "url": "https://about.gitlab.com/"
  },  
  "publisher": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "GitLab",
    "logo": {
      "@type": "ImageObject",
      "url": "https://about.gitlab.com/images/press/logo/png/gitlab-logo-500.png"
    }
  },
  "datePublished": "2023-03-01",
  "dateModified": "2023-03-01"
}
</script>


```

#### Please provide more information related to this engineering request
Make sure the information you provide is relevant for your request. If unsure, please provide all the fields. Add/remove rows as needed.

## Which page(s) are involved in this request?
* All topics generated by the BE repo


## In scope
What is within scope of this request?

- [ ] Adding code to topics template to generate schema
- [ ] Collaborating with @hsmith-watson to verify and iterate on this MVC 1 implementation


## DCI
[DRI, Consulted, Informed](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/people-group/directly-responsible-individuals/#dri-consulted-informed-dci)

- [ ] DRI: 'Engineer'
- [ ] Consulted: `@justin.vetter @laurenbarker`
- [ ] Informed: `Everyone`

title: Schema Generation for Breadcrumbs
description:
## Goal
We would like automate the generation of schema for breadcrumbs in the Buyer Experience repository..

@hsmith-watson provided a example of the schema markup to be generated [here](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/inbound-marketing/seo/-/issues/354#note_1307813023). Pasting it below as well. 

![Screen_Shot_2023-03-10_at_10.25.25_AM](/uploads/f1d1e753e9b6d2b929da676adc68e8ba/Screen_Shot_2023-03-10_at_10.25.25_AM.png)

```
<script type="application/ld+json">
{
  "@context": "https://schema.org/", 
  "@type": "BreadcrumbList", 
  "itemListElement": [{
    "@type": "ListItem", 
    "position": 1, 
    "name": "Topics",
    "item": "https://about.gitlab.com/topics/"  
  },{
    "@type": "ListItem", 
    "position": 2, 
    "name": "GitOps",
    "item": "https://about.gitlab.com/topics/gitops/"  
  },{
    "@type": "ListItem", 
    "position": 3, 
    "name": "What is a GitOps workflow?",
    "item": "https://about.gitlab.com/topics/gitops/gitops-workflow/"  
  }]
}
</script>


```

#### Please provide more information related to this engineering request
Make sure the information you provide is relevant for your request. If unsure, please provide all the fields. Add/remove rows as needed.

* All breadcrumbs generated by the BE repo

title: Automate Schema Generation for Blog Posts
description:
## Goal
We would like automate the generation of schema for blog posts.

@hsmith-watson provided a example of the schema markup to be generated [here](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/inbound-marketing/seo/-/issues/354#note_1307806277). Pasting it below as well. 

```
<script type="application/ld+json">
{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "BlogPosting",
  "mainEntityOfPage": {
    "@type": "WebPage",
    "@id": "https://about.gitlab.com/blog/2023/03/01/how-to-deploy-react-to-amazon-s3/"
  },
  "headline": "How to deploy a React application to Amazon S3 using GitLab CI/CD",
  "description": "Follow this guide to use OpenID Connect to connect to AWS and deploy a React application to Amazon S3.",
  "image": "https://about.gitlab.com/images/press/logo/png/gitlab-logo-500.png",
  "keywords":"DevOps, CI/CD",
  "articleSection":"Engineering",
  "timeRequired":"PT11M",
  "author": {
    "@type": "Person",
    "name": "Jeremy Wagner",
    "url": "https://about.gitlab.com/company/team/#jeremywagner"
  },  
  "publisher": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "GitLab",
    "logo": {
      "@type": "ImageObject",
      "url": "https://about.gitlab.com/images/press/logo/png/gitlab-logo-500.png"
    }
  },
  "datePublished": "2023-03-01",
  "dateModified": "2023-03-01"
}
</script>
```

#### Please provide more information related to this engineering request
Make sure the information you provide is relevant for your request. If unsure, please provide all the fields. Add/remove rows as needed.

## Which page(s) are involved in this request?
* All blog posts generated by the www repo


## In scope
What is within scope of this request?

- [ ] Adding code to blog post template to generate schema
- [ ] Collaborating with @hsmith-watson to verify and iterate on this MVC 1 implementation

[DRI, Consulted, Informed](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/people-group/directly-responsible-individuals/#dri-consulted-informed-dci)

- [ ] Consulted: `@justin.vetter @laurenbarker`
- [ ] Informed: `Everyone`

title: [ENG] Localized French and Japanese Sales Landing page
description:
## Goal
We would like to create a localized French and Japanese sales landing page to the Buyer Experience repository. This will enable use to explore the full lifecycle of localizing a page to multiple langauges. 

- https://about.gitlab.com/fr-fr/sales 
- https://about.gitlab.com/ja-jp/sales 

#### Jobs To Be Done
* **Situation**: *When a user visits `/fr-fr/sales` or `/ja-jp/sales`  the see a french/japanese version of our sales page*
* **Motivation**: *We want to learn what the level of effort is to host localized versions of our BE pages in 3 languages*
* **Outcome**: *So we can make informed decisions about our technical localization strategy *

#### Please provide more information related to this request
Make sure the information you provide is relevant for your request. If unsure, please provide all the fields. Add/remove rows as needed.

**Does anyone in leadership have eyes on this project?**
- [ ]  Yes @djsulliv 
- [ ]  No

**What is the ultimate end goal vision vs the MVC1 iteration?**
 - Work with MarketingOps to identify french and Japanese versions of our sales form
 - Create a french version of our sales page in Buyer Experience
 - Create a Japanese version of our sales page in Buyer Experience
 - Have this page ignored by our Swiftype search tool
 - Have this page ignored by all search engines (IE Google)


**What analytics / data will we need to set-up?**
- [ ] Yes: We'll sync with @dennischarukulvanich on this once review app is up
- [ ] No

## Page(s)
Which page(s) are involved in this request?
* https://about.gitlab.com/fr-fr/sales 
* https://about.gitlab.com/ja-jp/sales

title: [ENG] Personalizing Navigation with Demandbase
description:
## Goal

To utilize the [Demandbase API](https://support.demandbase.com/hc/en-us/sections/360011444531-API-Documentation) serve a personalized navigation if the visitor is coming from an Enterprise or SMB organization.

If the user is identified as Enterprise, we'll display a MVC to the navigation that results in increased engagement and conversions.

The goal of the issue is for the UX team to research the best strategy for personalizing the navigation if visitors are identified as an Enterprise or SMB visitor. From that research, then design a MVC personalized nav for enterprise visitors


#### Please provide more information related to this engineering request
Make sure the information you provide is relevant for your request. If unsure, please provide all the fields. Add/remove rows as needed.

title: [ENG]: Refactor ROI calculators
description:
To get the Time ROI calculator up and running quickly, I made a completely separate component from the Cost ROI calculator. If one calculator needs some CSS changed, you'd have to go into the other calculator's file and make that match as well.

I'd like to set aside some time to refactor the component to improve future developer experience, reusability, and ultimately minimize file page size.

Setting this as 4 points to focus on other critical issues in this iteration, but I'm happy to up those points if I end up getting a bigger window of time!

title: [ENG] Iterate on changelog pipeline
description:
## Goal
We would like iterate on the scheduled changelog pipeline. Right now it's running on the 1st friday of every iteration. We need it on the last friday of every iteration. 

We also need the changeblog pipeline to build a full artifact. This breaks the pipeline in www. [Example of broken pipeline.](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/www-gitlab-com/-/jobs/3831936555)

Related to https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/buyer-experience/-/issues/1923

https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/buyer-experience/-/issues/1752#note_1291874915

## In scope
What is within scope of this request?

- [ ] Update scheduled changelog pipeline cadence to last friday of iteration cadence
- [ ] Update changelog pipeline to build for site and artifact

title: [ENG] Personalizing Navigation with GDK Cookie - MVC 1, verify it's there
description:
## Goal

We would like to use the first party cookie create as part of [this issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/buyer-experience/-/issues/1919) and _verify_ that it enable the marketing site to recognize a logged in Gitlab user by using dataLayer in the console.

No UI changes here - we just wan't to see an object in the datalayer that tells us the cookie is present. If we can prove it's there, we'll circle back with UX on next steps. 


**Does anyone in leadership have eyes on this project?**
- [x]  Yes `@laurenbarker`
- [ ]  No

## Page(s)
Which page(s) are involved in this request?
* about.gitlab.com

## DCI
[DRI, Consulted, Informed](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/people-group/directly-responsible-individuals/#dri-consulted-informed-dci)

- [ ] DRI: `@miraclebanks`
- [ ] Consulted: `GitLab Handle`
- [ ] Informed: `@laurenbarker`

## In scope
What is within scope of this request?

- A dataLayer attribute on the homepage that enables an engineer to verify if they are logged into GitLab or not. No visual changes as part of this issue. 
- Create a video walkthrough showcasing the cookie as an onboarding tool

title: Analytics - Solutions CTAs
description:
## Goal
Please help implement click tracking on the Solutions page:
1. Update the `data-ga-body` attribute on links to `data-ga-location` on the Solutions page 
2. The card links (documentation, pricing tiers) will need specific attributes. Add the following attributes (please see the /features page as an example for coding): `data-ga-features`, `data-ga-features-sub`, `data-ga-features-sub-card`, `data-ga-name`, `data-ga-location`. 
3. Add the data attributes for anchoring links where `data-ga-location="anchor"`. 

Handbook: https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/digital-experience/analytics/google-tag-manager/#click-tracking
